events.name: Fireside chat with Nicoleta Mihali from Microsoft

venue.name: Microsoft Berlin
venue.address_1: Unter den Linden 17, Berlin (Entry via Charlottenstraße)

events.description:
Join us for a fireside chat with Nicoleta Mihali, Technical Evangelist at the Microsoft Accelerator (5th floor)!

About our speaker:

Nicoleta Mihali (@nikk_mihali) is a Technical Evangelist with Microsoft Germany with a focus on natural user interaction technologies, like Cognitive Services, Bot Framework, Cortana and Kinect. She works with developers on designing and building intelligent applications. Prior to joining Microsoft, she studied Computer Science and Human-Machine Interaction, and worked in the automotive industry.

In this event we will also host students from TYN (http://www.tynasbl.be/), an N.G.O active in promoting leadership and social entrepreneurship among young people in Belgium.

At Women Techmakers Berlin we are encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. Get visibility, networking and resources to make the tech community of Berlin diverse and inclusive!

Follow us on twitter (http://twitter.com/wtm_berlin)
Join us on facebook (https://www.facebook.com/groups/1106085959408694/)
See our other events on meetup (https://www.meetup.com/Women-Techmakers-Berlin/events)
events.how_to_find_us: Go around the corner from Microsoft Digital Eatery, ring the intercom for Microsoft Accelerator amd take the elevator to the 5th floor.

events.name: Android Study Jam
events.description:
Welcome to the Android Study Jam for WTM Berlin!

We are following Udacity's Android course "Android Basics: User Input". We will be reviewing the chapter Making App Interactive Part 2 , please prepare the contents at home before the event.

First time attending? You are also welcome to join! Try to start with the Udacity course before the event. You'll have plenty of time to catch up with the rest.

Links to the Udacity content:

Android Basics: User Input: https://www.udacity.com/course/android-basics-user-input--ud836

All online communication will go through the Android Developers Group Slack team, please join here: https://adg-berlin.herokuapp.com/ and then Join the #wtm-study-jam channel. 

All genders are welcome! 

We follow the Berlin Code Of Conduct http://berlincodeofconduct.org/

More Info: https://wtmberlin.github.io/android-study-jam/

--------------------------------------------

• Introduction: News from the community

Women Techmakers is Google’s brand and global program for women in technology. Women Techmakers provides visibility, community, and resources for women in technology to drive innovation and participation in the field. Women Techmakers events are designed to promote an environment of inclusivity for women in technology, as well as celebrate women leading the industry. We want to advance, grow, and celebrate women developers, designers, and technology entrepreneurs.

events.name: Google I/O Extended Berlin 2017
events.description:
Dear all,

Women Techmakers Berlin together with the Google Developer Groups of Berlin - GDG Berlin, GDG Berlin Android and GDG Berlin Golang - are inviting you to the Google I/O Extended 2017 at c-base space station. 

Google I/O Extended is all about bringing Google I/O, the most anticipated conference for Google developers, to your doorstep, giving you inspirational talks, hands-on learning, and a chance to hear more about Google's latest developer products live from San Francisco.
It is part viewing experience, part community building.

Agenda
18:30 - Time to get to c-base, grab something to drink and join in the excitement
19:00 - Keynote Live Streaming
20:30 - Get some more drinks and talk to other community members
21:15 - Highlights

22:00 - Developer Keynote Live Streaming

events.name: Google's Unconscious Bias Training
events.description:
Every day, we’re inundated with more information than we can consciously process. Research shows that simply raising awareness about unconscious bias can lead to more conscious decision making. Join us for a training on unconscious bias by Marga Manterola, Engineer at Google Munich.

THERE WILL BE ATTENDEE CAP OF 40 AT THE DOOR, PLEASE KEEP YOUR RSVP STATUS UP TO DATE

--

AGENDA

18:30-19:00 Networking

19:00-19:45 Presentation about unconscious bias

19:45-20:00 Break

20:00-21:00 Workshop: How to Respond to Bias

21:00-21:30 Q&A with Marga about her journey

21:30-22:00 Networking

--

Read more about unconscious bias (https://www.google.com/diversity/at-google.html)

Save the date and stay tuned for more details!

events.name: Stories of Bonial Women in Tech
events.description:
Join us for a panel discussion with a couple of great women who work in tech across different departments and positions and have key roles in the success of their company. 

You will be hearing about purpose, motivation, collaboration and will have the chance to engage in an interactive discussion and networking. 

AGENDA
18:30 Networking and Drinks
19:00 Intro & Welcome from Women Techmakers Berlin
19:05 Intro & Welcome from Bonial
19:10 Panel Discussion
20:00 Q&A
20:15 Networking and Pizza

Meet our panelists

Melanie Illies (Senior Product Manager)
With over 7 years in the company (one of the early starts!), Melanie has gone from Intern in online marketing to Senior Project Manager and has played an integral role in ensuring smooth and quality delivery of projects

Kameran Casey (Senior Director of Sales)
Kameran has been in the company for almost 3 years, is a top performer in US sales team, and works mainly with technology and telco clients. She has over 15 years of Digital Ad sales experience under her belt.

Maylin Leal (Software Engineer)
Maylin's career has seen her go from Student Web Developer to full time Software Engineer focused on Devops and Architecture Design in one of the most highly performing IT teams during the past 4 years. 

Christine Cline (Managing Director of the U.S. Business)
During the almost 2 years in the company, she started as VP of Marketing and was promoted to Managing Director of the U.S. business. Prior to joining Bonial, Christine worked in a variety of retail marketing roles for Sears Holdings, a top 50 US Retailer. 

Irina Zhovtobryukh (Head of Software Delivery)

Irina has been with the company for 2 years. She’s an expert in agile software development and team management and joined Bonial to drive the transformation to scaled agile. As head of software delivery she’s responsible for developing teams, coordinating the roadmap and ultimately for successful product delivery.

Kinga Schmidt (HR Manager)
Kinga has been working as HR Business Partner to the P&D team and has been playing a big supportive role to CTO/CPO and TLs in shaping culture and team dynamics for the past year and a half.

events.name: Carmen Andoh from Travis CI: Go for Beginners Workshop
events.description:
Hello ladies and gentlemen,

Get ready for an awesome evening: Golang for non-programmers workshop AND and fireside chat with one of the most inspirational women in today's tech community:

Carmen Andoh (@carmatrocity</a>) lives in New York and works on the Build Infrastructure team at Travis CI, HQ-ed here in Berlin. She is active in the Go NYC community and is a member of Golang's New Developer experience Working Group.  Come talk to her about your  experiences learning Go!

Our lovely hosts for the event are <a href="https://travis-ci.org/">Travis CI, who will be offering drinks and pizzas.
There will be a cap of 30 attendees at the door, please RSVP accordingly

The workshop is for complete beginners: Never wrote code before? you are in the right place, all you need is your laptop and lots of curiosity. We recommend for you to bring some business cards and some questions! 

Note: "Beginner" could mean a lot of different things.  Please take this survey so we can get a sense of what kind of beginner you are!

AGENDA

18:00 - 18:30 Welcome and Networking

18:30 - 19:50 Workshop Part 1

19:50 - 20:10 Break

20:10 - 21:30 Workshop Part 2

21:30 - 22:00 Networking

events.name: Hacktoberfest Berlin 2017
events.description:
Happy Hacktoberfest everyone!

Hacktoberfest is a partnership between Digital Ocean and GitHub, where we are celebrating open source software during the entire month of October, for the 4th year!

The steps are simple:

- sign up at the Hacktoberfest website
- make at least 4 pull requests between 01–31/10 to any public repo on GitHub
- get a Hacktoberfest t-shirt and stickers!

[here is how it looked in previous years, credit: Norio Nomura]

Hacktoberfest in Berlin!

To celebrate Hacktoberfest in Berlin, we will get together on Sunday, 08/10, in c-base. We have lots of coffee and the bar will be opened during the entire event.

You can come at any time and hack with us. The volunteers of the event will be wearing a special badge - feel free to approach them with questions! 

If you need help opening a GitHub account, making your first PR, or any other thing - join us, we will be there to answer your questions!

If you are already familiar with contributions on GitHub and just look for a nice environment for your Hacktoberfest hacking - join us!

If you want to introduce your open source project for contributions during the event - join us!

If you want to give a few hours and help others as a volunteer (doesn't have to be for the entire event duration) - join us!


What kind of open source contributions can I make?

New code, bug fixes, translations, proofreading, documentation and anything else you have in mind.

SecureDrop are looking for new contributors with experience in Python, systems administration, HTML/CSS, user experience design, and translation. The goal is to help every new contributor close their first pull request by the end of the day.

FAQ

- Hacktoberfest is open to everyone in our global community, including all genders, levels, professions, etc.
- It's completely free  
- The Hacktoberfes t-shirt+stickers will be shipped to you by Digital Ocean after the Hacktoberfest celebrations are done, and the team confirmed you followed all the steps
- If you don't have a project to contribute to, we will help you find one
- If you can't attend but still want to contribute - you can follow all the steps in your free time, this event is a get-together for the community

The organizing communities

The Berlin event for Hacktoberfest is done in collaboration between Women Techmakers, GDG Berlin Golang and SecureDrop. 

About SecureDrop

SecureDrop is an open-source whistleblower submission system that media organizations can use to securely accept documents from and communicate with anonymous sources. 

See the SecureDrop website
Follow SecureDrop on GitHub

SecureDrop was originally created by the late Aaron Swartz and is currently managed by

See the Freedom of the Press Foundation website
Follow Freedom of Press on GitHub
Follow the Berlin POC of the organization on Twitter and on GitHub

About GDG Berlin Golang

The Berlin chapter of Google Developers Groups Golang was established in 07/2011 and is meeting on a monthly basis since. We love hearing about projects of our members, discuss the language development and network with local Gophers and companies.

Join us on Meetup

events.name: WTMB: JavaScript Crash Course
events.description:
Welcome to Women Techmakers Berlin's JavaScript autumn course!

The course will be spread over 8 weekly meetings, we will go from learning the fundamentals to having your very own backend application deployed with Docker.

Here is our Syllabus.

The course will be instructed by a team of developers, headed by Armağan Amcalar, Head of Software Engineering at unu GmbH, and will be hosted at the King offices, in Hackesher Markt on Thursdays.

Course description:

This is a course designed for introducing JavaScript and Node.js as a platform for backend applications. It assumes that you know basic concepts of (object oriented) programming but we will start from the beginner level and build up. So, the more programming experience, the better — but total newbies are also welcome, provided that they invest the required amount of time for self-learning.

The course is designed around open-source technologies, so a Unix-like system, Linux or MacOS is preferred. Git and Visual Studio Code will be our main tools, along with Node.js. Windows is not preferred, but if you absolutely have to live on Windows, you should have a working git and Node.js installation, and the rest will work.


FAQ

- Some previous programming knowledge would be really useful
- It's completely free 
- It's both for beginners and not-so beginners
- Ideally you'll keep working on your project at home
- We are meeting every THURSDAY until 30/11
- The meetups at the King office
- There will be drinks and snacks
- All genders are welcome
- RSVP opens for the next meetup opens one week in advance, you can RSVP during class

About our Head of Instructors

Armagan is a software architect from Berlin and currently works as the Head of Software Engineering at unu GmbH.

Following the software craftsmanship philosophy, he has taught over 40 young engineering graduates on software and helped them enter the software industry.

For the last four years, he has been focusing on distributed cloud architectures and developed among many others an open-source framework, cote.js, for building microservices with Node.js.

Follow Armagan on twitter, github or on his own blog.

About Women Techmakers

At Women Techmakers Berlin we are encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. Get visibility, networking and resources to make the tech community of Berlin diverse and inclusive!

Join us on facebook and on slack

events.description:

Our October Fireside Chat is about mobile banking, and our hosts - n26 - are Europe's first mobile bank, headquartered in Berlin!

About Our Speakers

Noor Van Boven - CHRO at N26 and Former VP, Global head of people at SoundCloud. She is also the founder of Hellow, a professional network of women in Berlin, connecting dynamic professional women from around the globe.

Helena Wolf - Product Owner at N26 and Former Financial Analyst. Helena also worked as an Associate at Boston Consulting Group. 

Andrea Franke - Agile Coach at N26 and Former Scrum Master and Product Owner at  Edenspiekermann.

Alina Denisenko - Software Engineer at N26 -  Has always been a Software Engineer for more than five years :)

events.description:
Arrival instructions: the entrance is between HagenDasz and Butlers

Hello ladies and gentlemen,

Our November Fireside Chat has an exciting focus on Fintech and Payments! Let's meet and talk with the ladies at Adyen, get an introduction to their field of expertise and hear about their journeys.

AGENDA

18:30 - 19:15 Networking Over Drinks and Snacks

19:15 - 19:20 Adyen Intro

19:20 - 19:25 WTM Berlin Intro

19:30 - 20:30 Panel Discussion and Q&A with our Speakers

20:30 - 21:30 Networking 

ABOUT OUR SPEAKERS

Alexa Von Bismark

Alexa is the Head of Account Management at Adyen Germany and opened the Berlin office. Before Adyen she worked at another player in the payment industry called Skrill and an investment fund Montan Alternative Investment. 

Anika Wechsung 

Anika is heading the marketing activities at Adyen’s German office. Before working at Adyen, she was part of the Marketing team at the Berlin-based Fintech Barzahlen. 

Jenny Saft

Jenny is the Strategic Partnership Development Manager at Adyen, previously Strategy & Operations Analyst at Fyber in San Francisco and Program Manager at Deutsche Telekom. 

Inbar Kuperschmidt 

Inbar is an account manager at Adyen. Before Adyen she worked for PayPal and surprisingly enough also has a background as a manager in Nonprofit organizations.

ABOUT ADYEN

Adyen is the technology company reinventing payments for the global economy, delivering frictionless payments across online, mobile and in store.

events.name: WTMB: JS Crash Course Graduation + Chris Heilmann's talk
events.description:
We have made it through the Women Techmakers Berlin's JavaScript autumn course! 

Come celebrate with us: After 8 weekly meetings, where we went from learning the fundamentals to having your a full backend application deployed with Docker, we are presenting our projects, right after we'll hear a great talk by no other than Chris Heilmann!

AGENDA

18:30-19:00 Networking

19:00-19:15 Welcome notes

19:15-20:00 JavaScript is a buffet, not a main course / Chris Heilmann

Now that you learned about JavaScript, you're ready to take on the world as JavaScript runs everywhere.

The trick is to not get overwhelmed and to find what makes you happy as happy developers are effective developers. Chris Heilmann has a 18 year old history of using the language and wrote many books about it. Let him help you

not get lost in the rabbit hole that is JavaScript in 2017.

20:00 - 22:00 Project presentations

About Chris Heilmann

Chris Heilmann dedicated the last 20 years of his life to make the web work and thrive. As a lead developer on some of the largest web products he learned that knowledge is not enough without teamwork and good handover. He dedicated most of his time since on educating, writing and sharing, presenting on average at 30 conferences a year. He strives to make code and coders work efficiently and get more done quickly without losing the understanding of what we do. He is the author of several JavaScript books and the Developer Evangelism handbook. He is currently a Senior Program Manager in Microsoft and spends a lot of time pondering how machine learning and AI can aid humans and replace jobs we're too important to do.

</a>

events.name: Fireside Chat at Penta Fintech
events.description:
Hello ladies and gentlemen,

Our December Fireside Chat has an exciting focus on Fintech and banking for tech startups! Let's meet and talk with the ladies at Penta, get an introduction to their field of expertise and hear about their journeys.

18:30 - 19:15 Networking Over Drinks and Snacks

ABOUT OUR SPEAKERS

Katrina Elliott (@Kme0000), Business Development Manager   

Katrina joined Penta recently to work on developing the best new account for SMEs in Europe. She has spent the past few years researching the brightest new fintechs and banking innovations at Mapa Research in London. She is enjoying getting to know her new hometown of Berlin


Rhythm Walia, Full stack Developer  

 
Rhythm joined Penta as a full stack developer to build a more powerful business banking for startups. Before Penta she was working in Bangalore, India as a developer for Quintype. She is originally from Delhi and loves singing, dancing, and travelling.


Jessica Holzbach (@Jessica_Hbach), Co-founder & Head of Customer

Jessica joined Penta as a co-founder and is taking care of everything customer and data analytics related. Before Penta she found her first foodtech startup (IAWIE) and was working in management consulting for financial services. Besides that she is an fintech enthusiast, foodie and huge urban sports fan. 


ABOUT PENTA

Penta is a Berlin based fintech company redefining business banking by offering a business account for startups and entrepreneurs that helps save time and money so entrepreneurs can focus on their startup, product and team. 

ABOUT WTMB

At Women Techmakers Berlin we are encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. events.name: WTMB Wrapping up 2017: Public Speaking Workshop
events.description:
What a year was 2017 for the Women Techmakers Berlin community, many cool events and even more cool new joiners.

Let's all gather and look back at all we have achieved this year, celebrate what we have done and get a glimpse of what we're planning for 2018!

One of our main focuses in the past year was public speaking, and not only we gave our attendees diversity tickets to some of the nicest tech conferences in the area, but we also sent several speakers. We'd love to keep developing this, and so for this event, our very special guests will be Bianca Praetorius and Tim Messerchmidt, who will give us a workshop on public speaking!

AGENDA

18:45 - 19:00 Networking and snacks
19:00 - 19:30 WTMB: 2017 summary and glimpse into 2018
19:30-19:45 Break
19:45 - 20:30 Public speaking workshop / Bianca Praterious & Tim Messerschmidt
20:30-21:00 Networking and Holiday Wishes

About Our Speakers

Bianca Praetorious is an actress by trade and is a Pitch Trainer & Public Speaking coach since 2012. She trained the story, the deck & the delivery of over 450 Tech Startup Pitches for Teams in germany, europe and the middle east. She has helped to improve the Pitches at Wayra Germany, Startup Bootcamp, leAD Accelerator, Telekom Hub:raum, Plug&Play Accelerator, Tech Open Air Berlin, Hardware.co, RiseupEgypt, Sheraa@American University of Sharjah, Pitch@Palace Abu Dhabi, Google Launchpad and many sleepless, sweaty Hackathons. Bianca is the resident Storytelling Coach for TEDxHeidelberg and TEDxMannheim. She is a happy member of the sandbox.is (http://sandbox.is/) network and has a soft spot for robots, marching bands and cheesecake.

Tim Messerschmidt oversees the German-speaking countries as Regional Lead for Google's Developer Relations team. When not working with Android, he loves working with Node.js, and researching user authentication. Recently, Tim authored a book about identity concepts and data security for O'Reilly. Before joining Google, Tim ran PayPal's Developer Relations team across EMEA and APAC.

About Women Techmakers

At Women Techmakers Berlin we are encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. Get visibility, networking and resources to make the tech community of Berlin diverse and inclusive!

Join us on facebook (https://www.facebook.com/groups/1106085959408694/) and on slack (https://join.slack.com/t/womentechmakersberlin/shared_invite/enQtMjc1MTI1OTI3NTM4LThmZTgzOWEyOGY0MmMzYWQ0MTI1ZjFhNjc4ZGMyNjQ0MGY2MmIyNWVmMzlkNDc0NWFlM2Q4NDliM2EwZGZkOTM)

events.name: Fireside Chat at Native Instruments
events.description:
Hello ladies and gentlemen,

our very first meetup in 2018 will be the Fireside Chat with Native Instruments, a leading manufacturer of software and hardware for computer-based audio production and DJing. We will hear abou the music tech industry, get some tips for starting a career in that field and even see some of their products!

Share this event with your fellow music enthusiasts and producers, and join us for an evening full of interesting insights into audio production!

AGENDA

18:30 - 19:15: Networking Over Drinks and Snacks

19:15 - 19:20: Native Instruments Intro

19:20 - 19:25: WTM Berlin Intro

19:30 - 20:00: Development in Music Tech

20:00 - 20:30: Panel Discussion and Q&A with our Speakers

20:30 - 21:30 Networking

ABOUT OUR SPEAKERS

Steinunn Arnardottir - Director of Research
Software Application Development @ Native Instruments

Manuel Drews - Chapter Lead C++
Software Application Development @ Native Instruments

Katy Peichert - Senior Recruiting Specialist
Software Application Development @ Native Instruments https://twitter.com/berlinering

ABOUT NATIVE INSTRUMENTS

Native Instruments is a leading manufacturer of software and hardware for computer-based audio production and DJing. The company's mission is to develop innovative, fully-integrated solutions for all musical styles and professions. The resulting products regularly push technological boundaries and open up new creative horizons for professionals and amateurs alike.

Native Instruments sees itself as a part of a vibrant international music scene, and is in constant communication with artists whose feedback is integrated into the conception and continuous improvement of its products.

Native Instruments currently employs around 450 people in its offices in Berlin, Los Angeles, Tokyo, London, Paris, and Shenzhen. Our international offices in Europe, Asia and the US reflect how international we have become over the years. As a global company, we welcome diversity and appreciate the wide range of unique experiences that our team members have.

https://www.native-instruments.com/

events.name: You Don't Look Like an Engineer / Monica Sarbu
events.description:
Hello ladies and gentlemen,
we are glad to host a very special guest for a very inspiring talk:

You Don't Look Like an Engineer / Monica Sarbu - Team Lead, Beats @ Elastic Monica will share her experiences on how she has become an Engineering team lead at Elastic, a leading open source software company that to date has more than 100M product downloads.

From once being a female college graduate that no one was likely to trust, to now being in the driving seat of key technical product development decisions, Monica has embraced so many opportunities from both a personal and professional perspective and is excited to share her journey with you today.

The story has its up and downs, from quitting jobs when they were no longer challenging, to starting a company and pivoting into open source. All of this while continuing to balance parenthood and a growing successful engineering career.

For anyone who is based outside of Berlin or can't make it and would still like to attend the talk, you can stream it live through Press 'n Play: http://www.pressnplay.co/streaming/wtm_berlin

LINKS

About Beats: https://www.elastic.co/products/beats

events.name: Parents in Tech Day
events.description:
Being a parent is tech is not easy.
We want to make this statement not relevant!

A lot of progress is happening in the field of rights and benefits for working parents. While Germany is a global leader in helping parents maintain family/work balance, there is still a place for improvement. On Saturday, 10/02, we will get together at the Berlin offices of Mozilla, learn about rights and benefits of parents in tech, hear some stories from the people who are doing it, and network with other parents in tech and supportive companies.

👧 👦 AGENDA 👧 👦

10:00-11:00 Networking Over Breakfast

11:00-12:00 Talk About Parental Rights by Kave Bulambo

12:00-13:00 QA About Parental Rights

13:00-14:00 Lunch Break

14:00-15:45 Parents in Tech Sharing Their Stories
- Carmen Hernández Andoh
- Monica Sarbu
- Ola Gasidlo
- Ulrike-Marie Gerber
- Damnan Jovanović

15:45-16:30 QA Panel with Parents in Tech

16:30-17:30 Networking with Attendees and Companies Over Cakes

👧 👦 KIDS ARE JOINING? PRE REGISTER 👧 👦

Free child care (ages 3+) will be provided with pre-registration in this link: https://goo.gl/nTVX7g
Paid workshop for kids by Common Ground

Carmen Hernández Andoh | @carmatrocity | Travis CI

Damjan Jovanović | @damnjan | FUNKE Digital TV Guide

events.name: WTMB: JavaScript Study Group - Kick off event
events.description:
Welcome to Women Techmakers Berlin's Study Group kick off event for 2018!
We are excited to see the great demand, and to step into year 2 of this program :)
For this event, we have a very special guest: William Kennedy of Ardan Labs (https://www.ardanlabs.com/blog/)

We will meet every other week over the course of 3 months to work on our projects on a bi-weekly basis, just you, your project, the instructors and a whole-lotta-mate!

The format is all hands on: you can bring an existing project, whether from last year's course, or your own, or even come without an idea - we'll brainstorm together. Alone or in a pair, anything works.

You will get a nice working environment, with comfy seating, good wifi, drinks, snacks and brilliant instructors.

The purpose is to work on your project, and have something nice to show at our graduation event!

You are also welcome to join the JS Slack in the WTMB Slack, and ask your questions outside of the study group hours too.

You are encouraged, but don't have to, use our material from last year (http://wtmberlin.com/javascript-crash-course/) and this year (it will be on our website soon: http://wtmberlin.com)

The course will be instructed by a team of developers, headed by Armağan Amcalar, Head of Software Engineering at Unu GmbH (https://unumotors.com), and will be hosted at the Le Wagon offices.

🤓 🤓 🤓 🤓 🤓

FAQ

- Some previous programming knowledge would be really useful
- It's completely free
- Ideally you'll keep working on your project at home
- There will be drinks and snacks
- All genders are welcome

events.name: Fireside Chat at AKQA
events.description:
Hello ladies and gentlemen,

Let's hear about the ideas and innovation company - AKQA!

AGENDA

18:30 - 19:15: Networking Over Drinks and Snacks

19:15 - 19:20: AKQA Intro

19:25 - 19:35: WTM Berlin Intro

19:35 - 21:30: Panel Discussion and Q&A with our Speakers

21:00 - 21:30 Networking

ABOUT OUR SPEAKERS

Miriam Healy, Executive Director of Delivery & Operations
Miriam began her career as a software engineer delivering digital experiences at Moneygator.com - the first online financial aggregator and then at Secfinex.com - the first online securities lending portal. Delivering world first products and services is core to her DNA and is the reason she joined AKQA. Miriam relocated from AKQA London to AKQA Berlin to head up the technology department in 2012, implementing the technical processes, as much as the innovation for clients. Overtime she has taken on a broader remit at AKQA Berlin to help steer and inspire the team to achieve the best they can for all their clients. Ariana Sverdlik, Senior Strategic Planner
As a Senior Strategist for AKQA, Ariana is responsible for developing interactive and cross-channel campaigns and strategies. Prior to AKQA she led digital and social strategy for WNET, the largest station within the PBS network, for award-winning TV series including NATURE, AMERICAN MASTERS, and GREAT PERFORMANCES. Before WNET, Ariana served as Director of Social Media at digital agency 87AM where she was responsible for social campaigns and strategies for SWAROVSKI, L'ORÉAL PROFESSIONNEL, SCHOLASTIC and more.

Jess has worked at AKQA for more than 12 years, starting at the company’s New York office before moving to Berlin.

During her time at AKQA, she has created award-winning work for a wide range of clients including Coca-Cola, Johnson & Johnson, Kraft, Montblanc, Jägermeister, Nike, and Volkswagen.

Her work has been recognized at Cannes, the Clio Awards, the German Design Awards, The One Show and FWA, and has been highlighted in AdAge, Creativity, Luerzers Archive and New York Magazine among others.

Jessica Brazen, Group Creative Director
Jessica believes in giving back and mentoring the next generation of creatives. Over the past years, she has been involved with teaching initiatives, and also guest lectures to students at Miami Ad Schools in New York, Berlin and Hamburg as well as Berghs School of Communication.
Jessica is an accomplished artist, and has been featured in various painting and illustration exhibitions in the US.

Elena Kolpakova, QA Engineer
As a daughter of a software developer, Elena has been passionate about high quality since her early childhood. And with more than 10 years in the field, she’s gained a lot of experience in all kinds of testing. These days Elena practices test coaching and agile testing. At AKQA GmbH, she works as a Senior QA Analyst.

ABOUT AKQA

We exist to create the future for our clients. Join leaders who have built their careers at AKQA to discuss what progress means to them on a personal and professional level.

events.name: React Workshop - Part 1
events.description:
A crash course to learn what React is, when and how to use it.

Skill level
Basic HTML, CSS, and a good level of JavaScript.

What You Will Learn
- What is React
- Hello world – Your first React component
- Playing with props
- Component lifecycle
- State
- Higher-order components
- Manipulating data
- Styling
- State management

What to bring
Laptop, your favourite IDE installed (VSCode recommended), npm setup, GitHub account - optional

Instructors

-> Mike Smart (https://twitter.com/smartmike)

-> Hugo Giraudel (https://twitter.com/hugogiraudel)

Mike and Hugo are two Senior Web Developers leading the web team at N26. They have been working in the industry for over 6 years now, using React for at least half of it. Seeing it as a game changer for web development, they now want to share their experience with the technology to enable people to create enjoyable products for the accessible web.

ABOUT N26
N26 is Europe’s first Mobile Bank with a full European banking license. We redesigned the banking experience to be simple, fast and contemporary. With N26, you can run your entire financial life from your phone. Open your new bank account in under eight minutes, use your N26 Mastercard around the world, send instant money transfers to other customers, get real-time account notifications and much more, directly from the N26 app.

events.name: Fireside Chat at Honeypot
events.description:
Hello ladies and gentlemen,

For our March Fireside Chat we will hear the story of the ladies from Honeypot, Europe’s developer job platform.

From the business perspective, nowhere is the change in Human Resources felt more than with the task of building and scaling engineering teams. Furthermore, with a large shortage of developers, companies need to find innovative ways to recruit, and Honeypot solves these dilemmas. Before a developer gets accepted to Honeypot, there is a short verification process that includes a code review from open source contributions, such as GitHub, or with an additional coding challenge. This ensures a baseline quality level to every developer on the platform, which makes the search process more efficient for employers. On the other end, developers are able to select the interviews, offers and contracts according to their needs. The user profiles on the platform focus on these details and include a desired salary, location, information about preferred languages and even an option to work remote. Instead of the traditional process of applying to potential employers, at Honeypot companies apply to developers. This platform offers developers and companies a frictionless way to connect with each other in order to find the best match. AGENDA

18:30 - 19:15: Networking Over Drinks and Snacks

19:15 - 19:20: Honeypot Intro

19:20 - 19:25: WTM Berlin Intro

19:30 - 20:30: Panel Discussion and Q&A with our Speakers

20:30 - 21:30 Networking

ABOUT OUR SPEAKERS

Carolyn Stransky
is a jоurnalist and JavaScript developer based in Berlin. She's currently working as a Frontend Developer at Blacklane and teaching newcomers CSS at ReDI School of Digital Integration. Also, she is a Contributing Editor at FLURT Magazine.

Miranda Gowlland
has worked in digital since 2001. Having spent the earlier part of her career in marketing roles at travel start-ups, she then moved to Google and Facebook where she worked in a variety of commercial roles in the UK and Asia. Her last job was looking after TUI's acquisition marketing across Europe, before taking some time out to learn to code. She now works as a freelance digital marketing consultant and web developer.

Miruna Mitranescu
is a former tech journalist Miruna has previously led the content marketing team at a Paris-based startup. Passionate about marketing and tech she is currently the Head of Marketing at Honeypot.io

ABOUT HONEYPOT

Honeypot is Europe’s developer job platform connecting companies with the programmers they need. It was launched in 2015 and has since made a huge impact on the HR and IT relationship, thanks to its innovative pre-screening process, community-oriented engagement, company transparency — and also some great design.

*************************************************************************************

events.name: React Workshop - Part 2
events.description:
A crash course to learn what React is, when and how to use it.

Skill level
Basic HTML, CSS, and a good level of JavaScript. Please make sure you attend the first part of the workshop on March 12th.

What You Will Learn
- To be determined based on the progress from the first part of this workshop from March 12th.

What to bring
Laptop, your favourite IDE installed (VSCode recommended), npm setup, GitHub account - optional

Instructors

-> Mike Smart (https://twitter.com/smartmike)

-> Hugo Giraudel (https://twitter.com/hugogiraudel)

Mike and Hugo are two Senior Web Developers leading the web team at N26. They have been working in the industry for over 6 years now, using React for at least half of it. Seeing it as a game changer for web development, they now want to share their experience with the technology to enable people to create enjoyable products for the accessible web.

ABOUT N26
N26 is Europe’s first Mobile Bank with a full European banking license. We redesigned the banking experience to be simple, fast and contemporary. With N26, you can run your entire financial life from your phone. Open your new bank account in under eight minutes, use your N26 Mastercard around the world, send instant money transfers to other customers, get real-time account notifications and much more, directly from the N26 app.

events.name: WTMB: Advanced JavaScript Crash Course
events.description:
Welcome to Women Techmakers Berlin's Advanced JavaScript winter course!

***PLEASE NOTE***
For this session, bring your laptops with preferably Mac OS or Linux on them (you can try to make Windows work, but there's no guarantee). You should have Node.js and Visual Studio Code installed. We’ll also use MongoDB as the database, so it is recommended to install this as well.

Students from last semester will already have Docker installed on their machines, which will be very beneficial for this session. New students should try to install Docker as well, however, it’s not a hard requirement for this session.

About This Course:
The course will spread over 5 lectures during March through May, where we will dive deeper in JS, following our last year's beginners course. If you missed it - you can catch up, as all our talks are online and available here: http://wtmberlin.com/javascript-crash-course/

events.name: International Women's Day - the main event!
events.description:
Join us for the 4th International Women's Day by Women Techmakers Berlin, part of the global series of the Women Techmakers chapters, which is also our birthday!

This year's theme is Building a New Horizon, and we did everything to make sure it'll be mind blowing.

★ THE PLAN ★

- talks that'll build you a new horizon
- a message from space
- lounge on the Spree
- child care for your little ones
- awesome swag

★ THE SCHEDULE ★

16:45 - 19:00 Networking: focused on parents, open for all, child care available

19:00 - 19:30 Welcome Notes - with a message from space!

19:30 - 19:45 My Success Story with WTM Berlin / Lilli Baaske
An adventurous journey from being a UI Designer to getting her first job in development, as a WTM Berlin JS course graduate

19:45 - 20:15 Our Journeys with the ReDI School / Edlira Kasaj & Rita Butman
The new Women's Program and digital education courses at the ReDI School of Digital Integration from 2 angles: the program's director, and the graduate's point of view

20:15 - 20:30 Break

20:30 - 21:00 Games My Mother Never Taught Me / Eti Vidavsky
My life as a serial entrepreneur, and the knowledge I gained: how to identify and create global business opportunities, creativity, networking, collaborations, failure and success

21:00 - 21:30 Motivation and How it Drives Me / Inbal Cohen
A brilliant journey from low-tech to high-tech positions and how each played an important role in my understanding of what I want to do in life, what motivates me and how this journey opened my mind to new horizons

21:30 - 22:00 Networking

22:00 - 22:30 Open Stage for Job Seekers, Networking

Dinner served - 17:30
Child care 17:00-21:30

★ THE SPEAKERS ★

Lilli Baaske, WTM Berlin JS course graduate, UI Designer & Developer
Lilli studied Graphic-Design and worked as an Artdirector UI in web agencies. An awesome mentor and support through her Meetup network helped her to finally make the transition into tech.

Edlira Kasaj, Women's Program Director at the ReDI School of Digital Integration
A startup enthusiast and founder of the first ICT Innovation Center in Albania, Edlira has held various roles influencing strategy and policy in the ICT sector. She's also worked with developmental organizations (GIZ, USAID, and the UNDP).

Rita Butman, Telecommunications, InfoSec Professional and Teacher
Rita graduated from the ReDI School in Telecommunications Engineering. She worked as an Engineer, Supervisor and Project Manager with GSM providers in Syria, and as an Intern with Cisco and Netfox AG in Berlin.

Eti Vidavsky, Serial Entrepreneur, Founder & CEO at ZoiCom Global LTD
Eti founded and managed 5 companies in Israel, Turkey, UK and Uganda. She's also a board member in high-tech companies and a lecturer and mentor at the 8200 and Microsoft Accelerators.

Inbal Cohen, Technical Director at Free2Move | @inbalSigal
Born in Israel, grew up in the US and moved between different countries throughout the years. A passionate multitasker that gets excited about projects, products and meeting new people.

★ THE VENUE ★

Volkswagen Digital:Lab is Part of Group IT. Software is our business, Platform our Passion. Our day is based on empathy, transparency and short feedback loops for both our end-users and teammates. We build software using Lean UX and extreme programming methodologies but most important through small and balanced teams which are enabled to take decisions based on the users’ needs and our company’s goals.

★ ABOUT WTM BERLIN ★

We are encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. Get visibility, networking and resources to make the tech community of Berlin diverse & inclusive! Whether a WTM member, or a complete newbie - join us!

❤ Our meetups are always open & inclusive to people of all backgrounds - everyone is welcome! ❤

https://www.facebook.com/groups/1106085959408694

events.name: WTMB: Yoga Session & JavaScript Study Group
events.description:
Welcome to Women Techmakers Berlin's Study Group!

We will meet every other week over the course of 3 months to work on our projects on a bi-weekly basis, just you, your project, the instructors and a whole-lotta-mate!

The format is all hands on: you can bring an existing project, whether from last year's course, or your own, or even come without an idea - we'll brainstorm together.

You'll get a nice working environment, comfy seating, good wifi, drinks, snacks and brilliant instructors. Feel free to join the JS Slack in the WTMB Slack, and ask your questions outside of study group hours too.

The course will be instructed by a team of developers, headed by Armağan Amcalar, Head of Software Engineering at Unu GmbH (https://unumotors.com), and will be hosted at the Le Wagon offices.

YOGA SESSION

Thanks to Jatinder we have an addition to the study group this week: a yoga session to relax mind and body before we start crunching our brains! Just drop by, or sign up here to guarantee a spot: http://bit.ly/wtmbyogasession

🤓 🤓 🤓 🤓 🤓

FAQ

- Some previous programming knowledge would be really useful. You're encouraged, but don't have to, use our material from last year (http://wtmberlin.com/javascript-crash-course/) and this year (http://wtmberlin.com)
- It's completely free
- Ideally you'll keep working on your project at home
- There will be drinks and snacks
- All genders welcome

events.name: WTMB: Advanced JavaScript Crash Course — Lecture #3: Bridging APIs
events.description:
Welcome to Women Techmakers Berlin's Advanced JavaScript winter course!

The course will spread over 5 lectures during March through May, where we will dive deeper in JS, following our last year's beginners course. If you missed it - you can catch up, as all our talks are online and available here: http://wtmberlin.com/javascript-crash-course/

This lecture (#3 of 5) is about making use of external APIs. A web application of any complexity makes use of multiple 3rd party APIs, whether it’s a stock exchange ticker, a weather app, a news aggregator or something that interacts with storage services to store user data. In this session we will talk about modular applications and making use of existing APIs to grow the capabilities of our application.

Join the JS Course Slack channel in the WTMB Slack (#js-crash-course), to submit your homework, ask your questions, catch up on last year's material, or to ask questions from the latest lecture. This year we will keep uploading lectures, so don't worry if you have to miss one.

The syllabus is available on our website: http://wtmberlin.com/javascript-crash-course/

In addition to the lectures, we will meet to hack on our projects on a bi-weekly basis, just you, your project, the instructors and a whole-lotta-mate!

events.description:

The course will spread over 5 lectures during March through May, where we will dive deeper in JS, following our last year's beginners course. If you missed it - you can catch up, as all our talks are online and available here: http://wtmberlin.com/javascript-crash-course/

--

14:00 - 15:30 FLAP TO THE iOS GAMES by Mihriban Minaz
Mihriban works a full stack developer at Unomotors GmbH, working with Swift/Javascript/Node.js/Objective-C She is also a member of Women Techmakers Community

Mihriban will teach you the basics of developing a simple #iOS #game similar to 'Flappy Bird' in a beginner's #workshop. You will be introduced to #SpriteKit and #Swift4 and will learn the basic process of #gamedevelopment. No previous knowledge required, but bring your Macs!

Come to Mihriban's iOS #gamedevelopment workshop on April 24th from 2pm till 3.30pm: https://womenize.eventbrite.de/

Register for the workshop here: www.womenize.net

Also, don't miss the Fireside Chat after the Workshops.

Womenize! is the new action platform for talents in games, tech and digital business. After a successful kick-off in 2015 we are back with the 4th edition on Tuesday, April 24 and Wednesday, April 25, 2018!

Workshops: Tuesday, April 24, 2018 (11:00-16:00)
Conference: Wedensday, April 25, 2018 (10:00-19:00)

Combining practical and theoretical program parts, the format is designed specifically for women who seek to build a career in the fields of games, media and IT, including HR & culture managers, decision makers, institutions and multipliers. events.name: Women in Gaming
events.description:
It's the Berlin Games Week, and we want to focus on women and the gaming industry!

AGENDA

18:30 - 19:15 Networking Over Drinks and Snacks

19:15 - 19:20 Wooga Intro

19:20 - 19:25 WTM Berlin Intro

19:30 - 20:30 Panel Discussion and Q&A with our Speakers

20:30 - 21:30 Networking

*************************************************************************************

ABOUT OUR SPEAKERS

Elise Terranova
Elise is a cross-disciplinary designer and artist, currently working as a game designer in Woogas Jelly Splash team. In her spare time she runs the podcast Life and Dev, where she interviews people working in the games industry.

Glenna Buford
Glenna is an Engineering Lead at Wooga, with expertise in iOS and Android development.
In her spare time, she speaks at international conferences, is a Director of Women Who Code Berlin and a founder of Girls' Games Workshop, which teaches young girls about game development and programming.

Linda Kerkhoff
Linda is a Unity Engineer at Wooga, working on one of our newest puzzle games - Tropicats.
Together with Glenna she founded Girls’ Games Workshops, to teach young girls how to develop games. Besides that Linda is a regular speaker at international conferences.

Allan Cudicio
Allan is a Lead Game Designer at Wooga with a background in the business side of software development. A veteran of speaking at conferences and Diversity and Inclusion advocate.

*************************************************************************************

ABOUT WOOGA

Founded in 2009, Wooga has become one of the most popular developers of casual mobile games in the world. Based in Berlin, employees from around the world develop high quality casual games with engaging stories at the core of the experience. Wooga’s aim is to play a memorable and positive part in people’s lives and create joyful moments they look forward to playing everyday.
Find out more at www.wooga.com.

*************************************************************************************

events.name: WTMB: JavaScript Study Group
events.description:
Welcome to Women Techmakers Berlin's Study Group!

We will meet every other week over the course of 3 months to work on our projects on a bi-weekly basis, just you, your project, the instructors and a whole-lotta-mate!

The format is all hands on: you can bring an existing project, whether from last year's course, or your own, or even come without an idea - we'll brainstorm together. Alone or in a pair, anything works.

You'll get a nice working environment, comfy seating, good wifi, drinks, snacks and brilliant instructors.

The purpose is to work on your project, and have something nice to show at our graduation event!

You're also welcome to join the JS Slack in the WTMB Slack, and ask your questions outside of study group hours too.

The course will be instructed by a team of developers, headed by Armağan Amcalar, Head of Software Engineering at Unu GmbH (https://unumotors.com), and will be hosted at the Le Wagon offices.

🤓 🤓 🤓 🤓 🤓

events.name: WTMB: Advanced JavaScript Crash Course - Lecture #5 Advanced Database Constructs
events.description:
Welcome to Women Techmakers Berlin's Advanced JavaScript spring course!

The course will spread over 5 lectures during March through May, where we will dive deeper in JS, following our last year's beginners course. If you missed it - you can catch up, as all our talks are online and available here: http://wtmberlin.com/javascript-crash-course/

There is a lot more than meets the eye when it comes to databases. In this lecture (#5 of 5) w'll briefly look at concepts like CAP theorem, ACID, and see how MongoDB operates under these. We will also see advanced query constructs in MongoDB with aggregate queries for reporting and analytics and other features like full text search and geolocation queries.

Join the JS Course Slack channel in the WTMB Slack (#js-crash-course), to submit your homework, ask your questions, catch up on last year's material, or to ask questions from the latest lecture. This year we'll keep uploading lectures, so don't worry if you have to miss one.

The syllabus is available on our website: http://wtmberlin.com/javascript-crash-course/

In addition to the lectures, we will meet during the study groups to hack on our projects on a bi-weekly basis, just you, your project, the instructors and a whole-lotta-mate!

events.name: WTMB: Android Study Jam
events.description:
Welcome to Women Techmakers Berlin's Study Group!

At the Android Study Jam, you will learn to develop your first Android app, including basic XML and Kotlin, creating user interfaces and handling the user input.

More detailed information here: http://wtmberlin.com/android-study-jam/

On 2018 we celebrate the 4th edition of our Android Study Jam! And we have new content! We are going to teach you Android using Kotlin: A popular programming language that is easier to use than Java, it is fully supported for Android apps and it’s in high demand for Android developers.

On the first session, we will do a live introduction to Kotlin using Try Kotlin website. You don’t need to install anything, it runs on the browser. This introduction is aimed for non developers.

Then, we will be following the codelab: Build your first Android app in Kotlin.

The course is aimed for anyone who is interested in learning Android and creating their first app. Previous programming experience is recommended but not mandatory. The first session will have an intro to Kotlin for non-developers.

👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻

Calendar:

[masked]: Study Jam Kickoff + Introduction to Kotlin
[masked]: Codelab
[masked]: Codelab
[masked]: Codelab
[masked]: Codelab

👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻

How we work

We will meet Tuesdays from 19:00 to 21:00 for six weeks.

During the six scheduled sessions, we will follow the codelab Build your first Android app in Kotlin and we will go step by step through all the content. See the agenda below.

Working at home is not required but is encouraged.

Android developers, named as coaches, will be present on the study jam session to help the students.

We recommend you to attend to all sessions, but skipping a session and doing the codelab at home is perfectly possible.

👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻

events.name: Information Security and Data Privacy Evening
events.description:
**Please Note: Space will be limited, so please RSVP accordingly :)

With the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) enforcement date around the corner, it’s time we focus on the topics of Information Security and Data Privacy. It goes without saying that this significant and demanding field deserves much attention!

For the first time we will be bringing the Women Techmakers Berlin (WTMB) community together at Cisco’s openBerlin Innovation Center to highlight the current status, innovations and challenges in this field, and to also highlight the work and experiences of a range of inspirational speakers from this domain.

AGENDA:
• 18:30 – 19:00 – Registration, Networking over Refreshments / Food

• 19:00 – 19:10 – WTMB and Cisco Welcome Remarks

events.name: Fireside Chat @ 1aimGmbH
events.description:
[FOR entering the building use the link: https://light.ps/t/8175c19c3fb6]

Dear hardwarians and softwarians,

In today’s technological era, hardware and software co-design has become an irreversible path in product creation. Take your phone for example, and the challenge faced by product designers in updating hardware and software to continuously satisfy our demands for the latest surprise. How do we decide which of the two is more important? How do we ensure neither takes centre stage, but both marry together to complement one other?
We’re gathering together to discuss what it takes to build successful hardware and software products. What are the challenges faced by mechanical and software engineers; how do we combine best practices from both to marry them into one successful entity? We invite everyone interested in software, hardware, product design and co-design to share their experiences and thoughts with us, and hear from the leading women in Berlin’s hardware, software and hybrid start-ups.

★AGENDA★
18.30 - 19.00: Networking over drinks and snacks
19.00 - 19.15: 1aim Intro
19:15 - 19:20: WTM Berlin Intro
19.20 - 20.15: Talks with Q&As
20.15 - 21.30: Drinks, food and networking

Come join us to talk, share ideas, and hear from the women behind Berlin’s hardware and software start-ups!

★ SPEAKERS ★
Jessica Eyer - Lead Mechanical Engineer at 1aim
Talk title: “I need my space - the battle between electrical requirements and mechanical space”
Talk description: Discussion on PCB layout process
Bio: Jessica Eyer is a Senior Mechanical Engineer at 1aim. She lives in Berlin with her husband and 2 year-old daughter and remains happily oblivious of Twitter

Marian Montagnino - Software Engineer at GrayMeta
Title: Computer Vision and Go
Description: Computer vision is one of the strongest drivers of tech innovation today.
By teaching a computer to intelligently recognize the objects it encounters, an immense knowledge is gained about
the world around us.
Join this talk to learn how to develop your own Go applications for object detection.

Sophie Willborn - Founder at Headwave
Talk title: “How to not die from featuritis?”
Talk description: Everyone is trying to add more and more features to products. But that’s what kills it eventually. They key is to focus on the one thing the product is made for and to build a culture around it.
Bio: Sophie is in love with motorbikes …and to be able to listen to music while riding she invented a special loudspeaker for helmets. She is a mechanical engineer and the founder and CEO of Headwave. Sophie is a playful and bright person who loves people who don’t take life too seriously.

★ About 1AIM ★
1aim is redefining buildings. We provide businesses with a full-stack platform that optimizes and automates building management. With our secure access and identity solution, intelligent sensors and superior data analysis software, we are launching the digital era of buildings. We believe buildings should be more than static costly structures which is why our platform enables simple building management and superior user experience.

How to find the venue:
The event will take place at the garden.
Sign up with your email address in order to receive our proprietary digital key, called a "LightPass", to open the front door. We will send you this key in the days leading up to the event: https://light.ps/t/8175c19c3fb6

At Women Techmakers Berlin we are encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. Get visibility, networking and resources to make the tech community of Berlin diverse and inclusive! Our community is made of over 1,000 members meeting several times a month for different events - tech skills, soft skills and networking. Join us:

Follow us on twitter: http://twitter.com/wtm_berlin
Join us on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1106085959408694/
See our other events on meetup: https://www.meetup.com/Women-Techmakers-Berlin/events

events.name: July Fireside Chat: The missing 40% when applying for a new job
events.description:
Should you apply only if you meet 100% of the job description?
Absolutely not.

But past work in the field shows that while men apply if they meet about 60% of the job description, women will do the same if they meet 100% of the job description.

For our July Fireside Chat let's meet at Eurostaff and hear from the top HR companies in Berlin why is this happening, what are they doing to improve the situation, and how can each of us contribute to make this better.

Want to add a question? post it at our #fireside-chat channel in our slack: http://slack.wtmberlin.com/

★ AGENDA ★
19:00 - 19:30 Networking over drinks and snacks
19:30 - 19:45 Women Techmakers Berlin Intro
19:45 - 20:00 Agile Career Development, or How Concepts from Product Management Apply to Your Career / Ronna Steinberg
20:00 - 21:00 Panel about job descriptions and job applictions
21:00 - 22:00 Networking

★ About Our Speaker and Panelists ★

★ Ronna Steinberg, Senior Software Engineer @Dalia Research
Ronna is a senior engineer with 15 years of experience. She leads Women Who Go Berlin and offers free mentorships to women and gender minorities who wish to progress in software. She describes herself as a happy feminist, advocates that coding is for everyone, absolutely loves architecture and solving problems and will be happy to share that passion with you.

★ Alexander Kley, Recruitment Consultant @Eurostaff
Alexander Started working in Online Marketing, and later changed to IT Recruiting. He is really passionated about finding the perfect match for a company and a candidate. He is comparing it to "wedding planing". He wants that both sides are matching their expectations, going through thick and thin and are really happy working together.

★ Debora Lasoen, Talent Management Team Lead @Honeypot
Debora gained international experience in startups around the world in various industries before embarking on a coding bootcamp which led her to work with developers at Honeypot. Passionate about team dynamics and building great organizations, growing Honeypot Talent Management department while helping people to find their dream job.

★ Lily Uzunova, Tech Recruiter @Caissa Global
Lily helps developers find exciting career opportunities in the fields of Java, Ruby, Javascript, and DevOps. Having lived in multiple locations and worked in various fields, Lily has seen both the corporate environment and the startup culture from the inside. Starting her career in finance, she later decided move to Career Coaching and Tech Recruitment, where she has an opportunity to combine her deep interests in tech and people.

★ Ivo Betke, Managing Director Germany @talent.io
Ivo is a software engineer, entrepreneur and startup mentor with ten+ years experience in Software & Tech Recruitment. He started of as a freelance developer and later on founded webcrowd a specialized Berlin based freelance agency and recruitment company which he successfully sold to talent.io, a selective tech recruitment platform where companies apply to engineers in Berlin, Hamburg, Paris and London.

★ Eva-Marie Pickert Trainee Product Owner @Talentwunder
After finishing her corporate Bachelor degree in Business Administration & Information Technology, Eva was working in recruiting. Now she empowers companies to their "Unicorns" by helping them to help themselves. Currently in charge of Customer Success Management and supporting the Recruiting @ Talentwunder.

events.name: AI101: Introducing the AI & Machine Learning Series
events.description:
Women Techmakers Berlin brings you an awesome event dedicated to our passion and love for Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.

The evening will kick-off with an amazing panel from four inspiring individuals and moderator in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning talking about their experiences, women in AI, how to navigate cognitive technology spaces and much more!

Later on we will have an open stage for job seekers or talent scouts, a QA round and networking. 🚀🚀

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
★ AGENDA: ★

18:30-19:00 Networking over drinks

19:00-19:05 WTMB Welcome

19:05-19:10 Simplesurance Welcome

19:10-20:00 Fireside Chat with
Moderator: Chakameh Shafii, Product Lead at Simplesurance
Panel: Kenza Ait Si Abbou Lyadini, Senior Manager Robotics & AI at Deutsche Telekom
Boxun Zhang, Data Science Lead at GoEuro
Christina Jenkins, Data scientist N26
Nadine Brehm, Sales Leader Watson Data Platform

20:00-20:30 Open Q&A, stage for talent scouting

20:30-21:00 Wrap-up and Networking

★ ABOUT THE SPEAKERS ★

Christina Jenkins is a data scientist at N26, a leading mobile only bank based in Berlin with over 1 million customers. Her current focus is using machine learning and artificial intelligence to enhance customer experience, helping N26 on its journey to becoming the smart bank which customers love to use. Prior to N26, CJ spent 12 years working as an academic, researching the evolutionary processes that drive parasites to adapt to organisms. Her experiences in academia lend a fresh perspective when considering how machine learning can be utilized in banking.

Boxun Zhang is currently leading the data science team at GoEuro, developing machine learning capabilities to engineer the future of travel. Previously, he worked as data scientist at Spotify for several years, focused on user behavior modeling, machine learning, and experimentation. Before Spotify, he obtained his PhD in Computer Science from the Netherlands, studying user behaviors in large-scale Peer-to-Peer systems.

Kenza Ait Si Abbou Lyadini is Senior Manager for Robotics and Artificial Intelligence. In this role, Kenza is driving the RPA and AI solutions within the IT department of Deutsche Telekom. She is responsible of helping the internal customers identify automation and AI use cases and of developing the best solution to cover their needs. Her design thinking facilitation skills and her motto "common sense is not common" help her stay customer focused, enabling a user driven innovation!

Nadine Brehm is working in data and analytics Tech since more then 16 years. Currently she leads the Hybrid Data Management Business for IBMs Key Accounts across all major industries in Germany, Austria and Switzerland. She is driving the mission to make data simple and accessible, helping the clients on their journey to AI and helps to shape the information architecture of the clients in order to accelerate exploitation of Machine and Deep Learning.

events.name: Google Assistant Workshop: Build Actions for your Community
events.description:
Our workshop is open to people with any level of programming background, especially newcomers, so invite friends and family members. Let's spread passion for building some (more or less) useful programs!

If you've always wondered what happens after you say "OK Google," join us at the ThoughtWorks office for a full-day event dedicated to learning about (and building!) Google Assistant actions and conversational interfaces. Actions let users get things done through a conversational interface that can range from a quick command to turn on some lights or a longer conversation, such as playing a trivia game. In just one day we learn to program a chatbot that you can integrate into Google Assistant, Facebook Messenger, Telegram and many others.

To participate, you don't need any programming knowledge or technical skill. We are going to walk you through the entire process — from designing a good conversational UI (intelligent interactions via voice) to working with DialogFlow (platform for writing the chatbots) — and then have a half-day hackathon where you will be able to build an action that you've always wanted.

Create something that would benefit your local community — a city, a neighborhood, a workplace, or even a hobby group!

By the end of the event, your team will have created a full-featured action and published it to the Google Assistant directory for everyone to use!

If you had any questions or just wanted to chat, join our #bafyc-workshop Slack channel: http://slack.wtmberlin.com/

The event is led by Anna Morgiel, Android Dev & voice UI enthusiast and Ed Medvedev, a public speaker and a Google Developer Expert, and supported by a group of wonderful volunteers.

★Agenda★

Build Actions for Your Community is a full-day event, so get ready
for an exciting Saturday! We kick off at 10 am and wrap up around 6 pm.

10:00 Welcome notes
10:10 Building Conversational Experiences
10:40 Conversational Design
11:10 Coffee Break
11:25 Codelab: Build Actions for the Google Assistant (Level 1)
12:25 Lunch
13:25 Creating your own Actions for the Google Assistant
15:30 Feedback on the Actions on Google Platform
16:10 Demo your Actions
17:00 Networking

★About ThoughtWorks★

ThoughtWorks is a software company and a community of passionate, purpose-led individuals. We think disruptively to deliver technology to address our clients' toughest challenges, all while seeking to revolutionize the IT industry and create positive social change.

events.name: Intro to Privacy by Design

venue.name: Humboldt Institute for Internet and Society

events.description:
Interested in the future of your data and privacy? Then join us for an introductory look at the Privacy by Design (PbD) approach towards product, project and organizational development! This proactive method embeds privacy throughout the whole project and development lifecycle, and promotes data protection compliance.

At this event, we aim to discuss concepts, practical implementations, legal considerations and ethical aspects of this approach. We will also address jobs connected to this field.

Speakers include:
• Dr. Max von Grafenstein, LL.M. - Head of Research for the Governance of Data-Driven Innovation Program at the Humboldt Institute for Internet and Society
• Michelle Dennedy - VP and Chief Privacy Office at Cisco
• Joint talk by Dr. Mira Suleimenova, LL.M. - Legal Consultant and Researcher, and Lisa Trujillo - Technologist, Consultant and Researcher

AGENDA:
• 18:00 – 18:30 – Arrival and Networking
• 18:30 – 19:45 – Welcome and Talks
• 19:40 – 20:00 – Wrap Up and Networking

**PLEASE NOTE: Space will be limited, so please RSVP accordingly :)

★ THE VENUE ★
The Alexander von Humboldt Institute for Internet and Society (HIIG) researches the development of the Internet from a societal perspective. Their aim is to better understand the digitalisation of all spheres of life. HIIG makes substantive contributions to our understanding of the relationship between innovation and governance in the digital society. More info: https://www.hiig.de/en

★ ABOUT WTM BERLIN ★

events.name: Pitching Workshop: Quick Pitch – Don’t be Caught Pitchless!
events.description:
You might be called up on stage to pitch...
You might be at a networking event...
You might even strike up a convo waiting line for a coffee and realize - hey - I need to pitch!

Bottom line - you never know if the next person you meet could change your startup! You want to be armed with the perfect story of your venture at any given moment. Donna Griffit, an International Corporate Storyteller and Founder of www.invisu.me will share insider tips for getting your story straight and sounding great telling it. A few lucky companies will get to come up, pitch their story and get expert feedback.

This will be a very interactive workshop - please sign up in advance if you'd like the opportunity to be coached on your pitch and get your story polished by Donna.

★ ABOUT THE SPEAKER ★
Donna Griffit, Corporate Storyteller, has worked globally for nearly 15 years with Fortune 500 companies, Start-Ups and investors in a wide variety of industries.

She has consulted and trained clients in over 30 countries, helping them create, edit and deliver verbal and written presentations, pitches and messages.
Donna has the ability to magically spin raw data into compelling stories that captivate audiences and drive to results. Through her guidance clients have raised hundreds of millions of dollars.

Donna also created www.invisu.me – a tool that helps startups create their pitch to investors and get the meetings they want! To learn more, visit www.DonnaGrif.com

★ ABOUT THE HOSTING COMPANY ★

OLX has been a host of one of our Fireside Chats - we are happy to collaborate again on this exciting event!

We’re a global product and tech group.

17 brands. 40 countries. 4000 people. One mindset.

Our mission is to make it easier for people to buy and sell almost anything, promoting prosperity in local communities.

We are proud to be different, and we work differently too. We combine the spirit and agility of a start-up with the maturity that comes from being part of a 100 year-old company.

We are curious, ambitious and allergic to corporate interference. We improvise, experiment and push each other further, embracing uncertainty and driving change.
https://www.olxgroup.com/

events.name: Stuck with your idea?/Your idea perfectly shaped and designed within one hour!
events.description:
[★ an ID is required and you can join between 6:15PM and 7:30PM★]

Have a fresh idea that needs to be shaped? This tutorial will show how to start with a raw idea, visualize it, and then use the object-oriented approach to design the architecture.

★ Participants will learn ★
- how to develop the idea from scratch,
- how to develop and visualize the idea, create a basic visual design without any specific knowledge,
- hot to use principles of Object Oriented Analysis and Design,
- how to develop and show amazing architecture design.

You will learn to better understand where and how to start, analyze and decouple the system, create a clean, clear and extendable architecture.

★ Plan of the workshop★
1. Introduction to the workshop
2. The main goal and the main steps.
3. Dividing into teams 3-4 players (optionally one can make a single-player team, in case he/she wants to work at his/her own project, but: in the end of the game one will have to present his/her idea for the public).
4. Picking a topic for a project. For those who have no ready ideas, a hat with ideas is prepared.
3. Warm-up games to define an idea
4. Stylistic Patterns with examples of existing services.
5. Types of Users. UX Basics.
6. Structure the idea and develop further.
7. Brainstorming in Teams.
8. Creating prototypes.
9. Getting to know OOAD.
4. Pitch time- time to each team to present their project.

★ Main resources you will need ★
- papers and colouring pencils
- register a free account on figma.com <-----------
- draw.io

★ SPEAKERS★
Anastasiia Tymoshchuk
Senior Software Developer at Cyren GmbH
Working in the software development for almost 7 years (around 5 years in Python), including experience in e-commerce as well as game development. Every day she is dealing with lots of challenges when she has to consider software or library to start with, starting from the question of how to build architecture and finishing with a deployment. She has also a great experience in the design and development of the project from scratch to production.

Elena Volovicheva
Full-Stack Designer at Fonpit AG
In the company she is currently working for, Elena is responsible for UX / UI / Interaction Design & Front-End Development, as well as Design for Print and Corporate Branding Strategy. Working closely together with Project Managers and Developers on big projects, Elena actively participates in the strategy development, concept visualisation and technical implementation of the project.

events.name: React Workshop # 1
events.description:
Hi everyone,

You asked and we are bringing this back for you. Want to know what React is, when and how to use it? Then this is the right place to start.

Please note that this workshop has 2 parts, first one on August 28th and second on August 29th. If you are interested, we kindly ask you to attend both of them, as the second part will be closely related to the first one.

What to bring
Laptop, your favourite IDE installed (VSCode recommended), npm setup, GitHub account - optional

Skill level
Basic HTML, CSS, and a good level of JavaScript.

Some of the things you will learn
What is React, Hello world – Your first React component, Playing with props, Component lifecycle, State, Higher-order components, Manipulating data, Styling, State management

Instructors

-> Mike Smart (https://twitter.com/smartmike)

-> Hugo Giraudel (https://twitter.com/hugogiraudel)

Mike and Hugo are two Senior Web Developers leading the web team at N26. They have been working in the industry for over 6 years now, using React for at least half of it. Seeing it as a game changer for web development, they now want to share their experience with the technology to enable people to create enjoyable products for the accessible web.

ABOUT N26
N26 is Europe’s first Mobile Bank with a full European banking license. We redesigned the banking experience to be simple, fast and contemporary. With N26, you can run your entire financial life from your phone. Open your new bank account in under eight minutes, use your N26 Mastercard around the world, send instant money transfers to other customers, get real-time account notifications and much more, directly from the N26 app.

At Women Techmakers Berlin we are encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. Get visibility, networking and resources to make the tech community of Berlin diverse and inclusive!

events.name: September Fireside Chat at ZAGENO
events.description:
This month let's talk Biotech.

ZAGENO is a fast-growing life science marketplace with offices in Berlin and Boston, becoming the #1 life science marketplace and research community.

Our speakers will give us a glimpse into the life of the company and explain why this branch of the industry is interesting, especially for women.

Want to add a question or post a thought? use #fireside-chat channel in our slack: http://slack.wtmberlin.com/

★ AGENDA ★
18:30 - 19:15 Networking over drinks and snacks
19:15 - 19:20 Women Techmakers Berlin Intro
19:20 - 19:30 Zageno Intro: discover inclusive working areas
19:30 - 20:15 Panel with a Q&A Session
20:15 - 21:30 Networking

★ Amelie Deister, Search Engine & Content Marketer

Amelie is an MSc Medical Neurosciences, and has a deep-rooted passion for science, research, and discoveries - ranging from watching baby crabs at the beach to analyzing google updates. Following her courses of study in biology and medical neurosciences, she moved onto adaptive behaviour, cognition, decision making, and medical literacy. Today, Amelie applies her diverse skill set to compose SEO copy for e-commerce websites and science articles, while thinking about linked data, rich snippets, and onsite consumer behaviour.

★ Thea Kitzinger, Frontend Developer
Thea started designing and building Websites with HTML/CSS as a teenager in her free time and then decided to study computer science with a focus on media.

★ Anh Le, QA Analyst and Engineer
Anh was born in Ho Chi Minh city, Vietnam, has a diploma of commerce in RMIT University. Currently studying to become a Bachelor of Marketing in Saxion hogeschool, Netherlands. Soon to graduate from Bachelor of business administration in SRH Hochschule Berlin. Worked as Game tester at Anakan GmbH.

★ Zuzanna Roguska, Platform Tester
moved from Poland to Berlin a year ago. This Fine Arts graduate has found her own path to a technology career and is a platform tester since 2017. She has a background in language teaching and design.

★Raquel Pinho:
After a bachelor in Pathology, Raquel pursued a PhD in Neuroscience to understand the molecular mechanisms underlying neurodegenerative disorders, like Parkinson’s disease. Throughout her journey in R&D she worked extensively with genomic datasets and gained a growing interest in data analysis and tech.

★ ABOUT THE HOSTING COMPANY ★

ZAGENO is a fast-growing biotech marketplace for research materials offering independent and relevant bench knowledge. With their unbiased Scientific Score, scientists identify and purchase critical products for their work more reliably, faster, and cheaper - thus driving down the time & cost of scientific breakthrough.

https://zageno-jobs.personio.de/#department-32293

★ABOUT THE LOCATION★
Techspace Kreuzberg provides move-in ready workspaces designed specifically for tech scale-up teams. Techspace coworking spaces are created to accelerate business growth, helping bridge the gap from startup to scaleup https://www.techspace.co/

★ ABOUT WTM BERLIN ★
