events.name: The key to an innovative Company: Create content that your customers will love
events.description:
The hypothesis:
Happy people create products that customer love. Happiness is a precondition for creativity and creative solutions lead to Innovations. And all that happens embedded in structures and processes.

★ ABOUT THE EVENT★
★Scientific research and Lessons Learned on Happiness, creativity and innovation
★Overview of Methods and Structures for Product Development, applicable to all sizes of organizations
★High Performance and the role of a Healthy lifestyle
★General principles that can be applied to all types of organizations
ideas and inspiration for participants to apply

★AGENDA★
- Arrival and reception
- Interactive Talk
- Short Q&A Session
- Mingling and Networking

★SPEAKERS★
Delhi Premoli works in Happyforce, an anonymous and transparent feedback application which focuses on employee wellbeing and happiness. Her current role is Business Development Manager. Delhi graduated with a bachelors in business management and technology from La Salle Ramon Llull University in Barcelona, and an exchange program in IESEG Paris. She was born in Argentina but has lived in seven countries around the world but currently based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Sharon Ortega http://toastbarcelona.com
Sharon has a background in the corporate world as a Marketing Manager.
She has spent the last years exploring food, nutrition and habits that lead to feeling better. Less stressed, more productive, happier, better skin and body shape.
She focuses on natural, non-processed foods, easy and time efficient cooking for busy people and mindfulness.

Sabrina Hauptman http://globalavengers.com/ XING LinkedIn
Throughout her career, Sabrina has been researching and experimenting in the field of Innovation and Creativity in scaled IT organizations and build and grown a network of thought leaders and practitioners across industries to discuss shared challenges about organizations.
Sabrina has spent her professional career in large-scale IT organizations working as an (agile) Project Manager, Agile Coach, Organizational Designer and Innovation Manager for the professional network XING SE, the biggest german ecommerce retailer Otto GmbH & Co KG and most recently for the multinational travel agency eDreams ODIGEO
Today Sabrina dedicates herself to Research in that field, sharing knowledge and building a network to discuss and tackle challenges that we all share and to spread ideas and skills.

events.name: iOS Study Jam #1 Session
events.description:
Are you interested in learning Swift/iOS? Then this is the right study jam for you.
We are excited to invite you to our iOS Study Jam 2018. There will be 10 sessions between Oct 2nd - December 4th, one every week, each lasting for approximately 3h.

★ #1 Study Jam ★: Introduction to Xcode, Storyboards, Playground

First steps in iOS development. What is Xcode and how to cook it. Learn tips and tricks of this powerful IDE, create your own project and try to play in Xcode Playground.

events.name: WTMB: JavaScript Crash Course Vol.2 Lecture 1: JavaScript & ES6 Fundamentals
events.description:
Welcome to Women Techmakers Berlin's JavaScript autumn course! For this meetup, we teamed up with Codemotion. Use the following code, to get a 20% discount on conference tickets:
COMMUNITY_WOMENTECHMAKERSBERLIN

The course will be spread over 8 weekly meetings, we will go from learning the fundamentals to having your very own backend application deployed with Docker.

Maria Ovsyannikova, co-organizer: I am one of the graduates from the first edition. After finishing the course I got a 6-month internship position. I currently work as a full-time Junior Full-stack Software Engineer.

Lecture 1: JavaScript & ES6 Fundamentals
An introduction on how JavaScript works and how to take advantage of the new ES6 syntax and features. In this session, we cover the basic programming paradigms in JavaScript, as well as topics like OOP and functional programming. We use the Chrome browser as a playground for an interactive session.

Here is our Syllabus (http://wtmberlin.com/javascript-crash-course/).

The course will be instructed by a team of developers, headed by Armağan Amcalar, Head of Software Engineering at unu GmbH (https://unumotors.com), and will be hosted at Eurostaff, in Mitte on Wednesdays.

Course description:
This is a course designed for introducing JavaScript and Node.js as a platform for backend applications. It assumes that you know basic concepts of (object oriented) programming but we will start from the beginner level and build up. So, the more programming experience, the better — but total newbies are also welcome, provided that they invest the required amount of time for self-learning.

The course is designed around open-source technologies, so a Unix-like system, Linux or MacOS is preferred. Git and Visual Studio Code will be our main tools, along with Node.js. Windows is not preferred, but if you absolutely have to live on Windows, you should have a working git and Node.js installation, and the rest will work.

FAQ
- #js-crash-course on our slack
- Some previous programming knowledge would be really useful
- It's completely free
- It's both for beginners and not-so beginners
- Ideally you'll keep working on your project at home
- We are meeting every WEDNESDAY until 5th of December
- The meetups at the Eurostaff office
- There will be drinks and snacks
- All genders are welcome
- RSVP opens one week in advance

About our Head of Instructors
Armagan is a software architect from Berlin and currently works as the Head of Software Engineering at unu GmbH.

Following the software craftsmanship philosophy, he has taught over 40 young engineering graduates on software and helped them enter the software industry.

For the last five years, he has been focusing on distributed cloud architectures and developed among many others an open-source framework, cote.js, for building microservices with Node.js.

Follow Armagan on twitter.com/dashersw, https://github.com/dashersw or on his own blog https://arm.ag.

About Women Techmakers


Apart from programming courses, we organize workshops on topics like Public Speaking, React, Angular, Google Assistant and Fireside Chats with companies supporting diversity in Berlin’s tech ecosystem.

Slack http://slack.wtmberlin.com #js-crash-course
Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/WomenTechmakersBerlinPage/
Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1106085959408694/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/WTM_berlin
Meetup: www.meetup.com/women-Techmakers-Berlin/

events.name: Hacktoberfest in Berlin
events.description:
Happy Hacktoberfest everyone!

Hacktoberfest is a partnership between Digital Ocean, GitHub, Twilio and Microsoft, where we are celebrating open source software during the entire month of October, for the 5th year. Support open source and earn a limited edition T-shirt!

★ The steps are simple ★
- sign up at the Hacktoberfest website (https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com/)
- make at least 5 pull requests between 01–31/10 to any public repo on GitHub
- get a Hacktoberfest t-shirt and stickers sent to you!

★ Hacktoberfest in Berlin ★
To celebrate Hacktoberfest in Berlin, Women Techmakers Berlin + the Go User group are getting together on 13/10 at Full Node. Drinks and snacks will be provided!

★ You can come at any time and hack with us. The volunteers of the event will be wearing a special badge - feel free to approach them with questions! It's ok to come for just 1-2 hours.

★ If you need help opening a GitHub account, making your first PR, or any other thing - join us, we will be there to answer your questions!

★ If you are already familiar with contributions on GitHub and just look for a nice environment for your Hacktoberfest hacking - join us!

★ If you want to introduce your open source project for contributions during the event - join us!

★ If you want to give a few hours and help others as a volunteer (doesn't have to be for the entire event duration) - join us!

★ What kind of open source contributions can I make?
New code, bug fixes, translations, proofreading, documentation and anything else you have in mind.

★ FAQ ★

★ Hacktoberfest is an online event open to everyone in our global community, including all genders, levels, professions, etc.
★ It's completely free
★ The Hacktoberfes t-shirt+stickers will be shipped to you by Digital Ocean after the Hacktoberfest celebrations are done, and the team confirmed you followed all the steps
★ If you don't have a project to contribute to, we will help you find one
★ If you can't attend but still want to contribute - you can follow all the steps in your free time, this event is a get-together for the community

★ ABOUT THE BERLIN GO USER GROUP ★

The Berlin chapter of Google Developers Groups for Go was established in 07/2011 and is meeting on a monthly basis since. We love hearing about projects of our members, discuss the language development and network with local Gophers and companies.

Follow us on Twitter:
http://twitter.com/gdgberlingolang

Join us on Meetup:
https://www.meetup.com/golang-users-berlin/

★ ABOUT WTM BERLIN ★
At Women Techmakers Berlin we have been encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. We strive for visibility, networking and resources to make the tech community of Berlin inclusive. We are one of the most active chapters of the global Women Techmakers program run by Google.

Our meetup groups are always open to people of all backgrounds, regardless of gender, age, race, expertise, etc. - everyone is welcome!

https://twitter.com/wtm_berlin

https://www.facebook.com/groups/1106085959408694

http://slack.wtmberlin.com

events.name: WTMB: JavaScript Crash Course Vol.2 Lecture 3: Promises and Async Programming
events.description:
Welcome to Women Techmakers Berlin's JavaScript autumn course! For this meetup, we teamed up with Codemotion. Use the following code, to get a 20% discount on conference tickets:
COMMUNITY_WOMENTECHMAKERSBERLIN

The course will be spread over 8 weekly meetings, we will go from learning the fundamentals to having your very own backend application deployed with Docker.

Maria Ovsyannikova, co-organizer: I am one of the graduates from the first edition. After finishing the course I got a 6-month internship position. I currently work as a full-time Junior Full-stack Software Engineer.

Lecture 3: Promises and Async Programming
This session focuses on solving the challenges of asynchronous programming with certain constructs in Node.js — promises, async and await keywords. We discuss how each implementation enables a certain way of programming, and introduce a control flow library called async. We also touch upon streams and stream programming.

Here is our Syllabus (http://wtmberlin.com/javascript-crash-course/).

The course will be instructed by a team of developers, headed by Armağan Amcalar, Head of Software Engineering at unu GmbH (https://unumotors.com), and will be hosted at Eurostaff, in Mitte on Wednesdays.

We are excited to invite you to our iOS Study Jam 2018. There will be 10 sessions between Oct 2nd - December 4th, one every week, each lasting for approximately 3h.

★ #5 Study Jam ★: App. Makeup (Layouts, views, custom views)

This session will give a chance to learn how to make a good looking app using iOS framework. Applying style is fun. Use colors, fonts and images! Learn to decompose screens to components, learn how to build custom components on your own. Learn to align and layout views easily with constraints and build UIs that adjusts to any screen.

★Presenter★:

Yunus Güzel
Team Lead and iOS Developer at Blacklane. Graduated and worked in Ankara. Enthusiastic about development and entrepreneurship. Likes Storyboards.
https://twitter.com/yunuserenguzel

Andrii Kosovych
iOS Developer at Zalando. Awesome dude.

★ Who is this for? ★

You are new to Swift/iOS: This is your first experience with it!

You have some previous programming experience: This Study Jam does not cover the basics of programming!

You are willing to learn in an inclusive, safe space and willing to follow our code of conduct: http://berlincodeofconduct.org/

★ What will you need? ★
-> Mac and charger
-> Create a free account at https://developer.apple.com/
-> Install Xcode 10.0 > from the https://developer.apple.com/download/
-> Curiosity and your desire to learn

Our meetup groups are always open to people of all backgrounds, regardless of gender, age, race, expertise, etc. - everyone is welcome!

All our events are free of charge. We offer:

events.name: WTMB: JavaScript Crash Course Vol.2 Lecture 4: HTTP APIs with Express.js
events.description:
Welcome to Women Techmakers Berlin's JavaScript autumn course! For this meetup, we teamed up with Codemotion. Use the following code, to get a 20% discount on conference tickets:
COMMUNITY_WOMENTECHMAKERSBERLIN

The course will be spread over 8 weekly meetings, we will go from learning the fundamentals to having your very own backend application deployed with Docker.

Maria Ovsyannikova, co-organizer: I am one of the graduates from the first edition. After finishing the course I got a 6-month internship position. I currently work as a full-time Junior Full-stack Software Engineer.

Lecture 1: JavaScript & ES6 Fundamentals
An introduction on how JavaScript works and how to take advantage of the new ES6 syntax and features. In this session, we cover the basic programming paradigms in JavaScript, as well as topics like OOP and functional programming. We use the Chrome browser as a playground for an interactive session.

Here is our Syllabus (http://wtmberlin.com/javascript-crash-course/).

The course will be instructed by a team of developers, headed by Armağan Amcalar, Head of Software Engineering at unu GmbH (https://unumotors.com), and will be hosted at Eurostaff, in Mitte on Wednesdays.

Course description:
This is a course designed for introducing JavaScript and Node.js as a platform for backend applications. It assumes that you know basic concepts of (object oriented) programming but we will start from the beginner level and build up. So, the more programming experience, the better — but total newbies are also welcome, provided that they invest the required amount of time for self-learning.

The course is designed around open-source technologies, so a Unix-like system, Linux or MacOS is preferred. Git and Visual Studio Code will be our main tools, along with Node.js. Windows is not preferred, but if you absolutely have to live on Windows, you should have a working git and Node.js installation, and the rest will work.

FAQ
- #js-crash-course on our slack
- Some previous programming knowledge would be really useful
- It's completely free
- It's both for beginners and not-so beginners
- Ideally you'll keep working on your project at home
- We are meeting every WEDNESDAY until 5th of December
- The meetups at the Eurostaff office
- There will be drinks and snacks
- All genders are welcome
- RSVP opens one week in advance

About our Head of Instructors
Armagan is a software architect from Berlin and currently works as the Head of Software Engineering at unu GmbH.

Following the software craftsmanship philosophy, he has taught over 40 young engineering graduates on software and helped them enter the software industry.

For the last five years, he has been focusing on distributed cloud architectures and developed among many others an open-source framework, cote.js, for building microservices with Node.js.

Follow Armagan on twitter.com/dashersw, https://github.com/dashersw or on his own blog https://arm.ag.

About Women Techmakers


Apart from programming courses, we organize workshops on topics like Public Speaking, React, Angular, Google Assistant and Fireside Chats with companies supporting diversity in Berlin’s tech ecosystem.

Slack http://slack.wtmberlin.com #js-crash-course
Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/WomenTechmakersBerlinPage/
Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1106085959408694/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/WTM_berlin
Meetup: www.meetup.com/women-Techmakers-Berlin/

events.name: Flutter Study Jam (Session 4) - Build Mobile Apps for Android and iOS
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps? Join us!

★ Who is this for? ★

You are new to Flutter: This is your first experience with it!

You have some previous programming experience: This Study Jam does not cover the basics of programming!

You are willing to learn in an inclusive, safe space and willing to follow our code of conduct: http://berlincodeofconduct.org/

★ How we work ★

Please install all the required tools before the first session.
Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

We will meet on Thursday at Babbel offices in Berlin from 19:00 to 21:00

During the next sessions, we will be following the free course: Build Native Mobile Apps with Flutter from Udacity, made by Google.

https://www.udacity.com/course/build-native-mobile-apps-with-flutter--ud905

We will watch the videos from the course, complemented with the support of our teachers, and we will work together (via pair programming) on the quizzes presented.

★ Instructors ★

Lara Martin: Android Engineer at Babbel
Fred Gonçalves: Android Engineer at Babbel

★ ABOUT WTM BERLIN ★

At Women Techmakers Berlin we have been encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. We strive for visibility, networking and resources to make the tech community of Berlin inclusive.

Our meetup groups are always open to people of all backgrounds, regardless of gender, age, race, expertise, etc. - everyone is welcome!

https://twitter.com/wtm_berlin

Join us on FACEBOOK:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/1106085959408694

events.name: DACHFest 2018 (DevFest DACH)
events.description:
For this year's DevFest season, GDG and WTM communities of Germany, Austria, and Switzerland are all working together to organize our largest event yet: DACHFest!

DACHFest is a two-day DevFest conference focused on making a difference. Meet technology experts in emerging fields like AR/VR and Voice UI, discover all the different ways in which technology is transforming lives, find out how to make your apps and websites accessible and friendly towards everyone, learn the secrets of building and nurturing a diverse community — let our speakers surprise and inspire you! And don't forget to make new friends: there will be plenty of opportunities to meet people passionate about your favorite things. ❤️

Join us in Munich on November 10–11 for two days full of talks, workshops, showcases, networking, and fun!

DACHFest is a paid event, but diversity scholarships are available for people who belong to underrepresented groups in tech or cannot afford a ticket.

Website: https://dachfest.com
Twitter: https://twitter.com/dachfest

events.name: The Power of Community Driving Diversity&Inclusion @ Togetherfest
events.description:
Women Techmakers Berlin has grown quite a bit over the last few years and we are happy to invite you to join us for a celebration of entrepreneurship and social good.
Meetup and WeWork are pairing up to host Togetherfest X Creator Awards in Berlin and we're organizing one of our favourite types of events in the beginning of the evening - a fireside chat to discuss about the power of community, bringing people together and enabling diversity and inclusion in tech.

So, will you join our conversation and come meet us at Togetherfest x Creator Awards?
Please RSVP on both Meetup and here (https://creatorberlin.splashthat.com/) as we only have limited space available.

★ What to expect? ★
-> Women Techmakers Berlin Meetup: 6:00 pm - 7:30 pm
Irina Nistor (Senior Producer @ Zalando) and Corina Dumanovschi (Senior Product Manager & Women Techmakers Berlin Organizer) will welcome you to our fireside chat. Come network for a bit and then let's talk.
-> Creator Awards: 8:00 pm
-> Afterparty: 9:30pm with musical performance by Mark Ronson

Our fireside chat speakers
★ Irina Nistor ( https://www.linkedin.com/in/irinanistor/ ) ★
Irina is a Senior Producer at Zalando in Berlin, working with software development teams. In Zalando, she is also one of the Diversity Guild members, driving internal I&D projects. In 2016, Irina has co-founded WIT Ruhr, the first community of women in tech in the Ruhr area, Germany (http://wit-ruhr.de/) that has the purpose to foster a strong network to empower women, inspire tech culture and reimagine workplaces.

★ Corina Dumanovschi ( @corinasaysstuff )★
Corina is a passionate Senior Product Manager, geek, problem solver, Women Techmakers Berlin Organizer & Avid Skier. She is a strong advocate that diversity & inclusion make teams and companies more successful.

You can find more info here: https://creatorberlin.splashthat.com/

events.description:
Details
Interested to know what it takes to get started in Open Source? Want to know what local projects and communities you can get involved with?

In this cross community event we will cover what Open Source means, why you should contribute to Open Source projects, the tools to get started and have a selection of local projects/ contributors pitch the projects they contribute to and why you should join them :)

****** Please sign up for the event here: ****** https://www.meetup.com/opensourcediversity/events/255369540/

Open Source is not only a great way to code on larger projects with a community of developers, but also it will help you become a better developer, build up a work history on GitHub and connection to the wider community.

“The gender imbalance in open source remains profound: 95% of respondents are men; just 3% are women and 1% are non-binary.” http://opensourcesurvey.org

This cross community event is aimed at engaging more women in Open Source projects by connecting them to safe and diverse projects.

If you contribute to a project or know one you would like highlighted in this event either as a presentation or as part of a repository of projects please fill in this form: https://goo.gl/forms/NLWenpUCton3kTjo2

events.name: November Fireside Chat at Doodle
events.description:
"Let's set up a Doodle to find time for the meeting" is something we all hear here and there. Join us for the November Fireside Chat to learn about the magic that is happening behind the scenes!

A question or post a thought? use #fireside-chat channel in our slack: http://slack.wtmberlin.com/

★ AGENDA ★
18:30 - 19:15 Networking over drinks and snacks
19:15 - 19:20 Women Techmakers Berlin Intro
19:20 - 19:30 Doodle Intro
19:30 - 20:15 Panel with a Q&A Session
20:15 - 21:30 Networking

★ ABOUT THE SPEAKERS ★

Laura Mobilio, Product Manager
Laura has a passion for growth hacking (besides dancing and good food)! Laura has studied at Bocconi university in Milan and has experience with growing and structuring early stage startups.

Améline Cunin, Product Designer
For Améline's first project in Doodle she was working on the native app, now she is focusing on UX Research. She has changed her career from performance marketing to UX 2 years ago.

Büşra Coşkuner, Senior Product Manager
Büşra has studied Industrial Engineering and Management in Berlin, and since her studies always swam in both the technical and the business sea. She loves experimentation as she believes the answers don’t lie in discussions and theories. She combines work and life by applying learnings from her hobbies (traveling and dancing) to product development

★ ABOUT HOSTING COMPANY ★

Doodle is the world’s favourite online scheduling with over 28 million monthly users, today. We are growing at a very fast pace, and strive to be the go-to platform for whenever business people manage their calendars and meetings. Our team consists of passionate engineers, designers, product managers, marketers, senior support located in Belgrade, Berlin, Tel Aviv and Zurich!

At Doodle we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities (EEO) are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, colour, disability, religion, gender, orientation. Doodle embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work and our products will be.

★ ABOUT WTM BERLIN ★

At Women Techmakers Berlin we have been encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. We strive for visibility, networking and resources to make the tech community of Berlin inclusive. We are one of the most active chapters of the global Women Techmakers program run by Google.

Our meetup groups are always open to people of all backgrounds, regardless of gender, age, race, expertise, etc. - everyone is welcome!

All our events are free of charge. We offer:
-> FiresideChats with interesting companies with Q&A Sessions
-> Programming courses: Javascript Study Jam, Make your first App in Kotlin Study Jam, Flutter Study jam
-> Workshops on topics like Google Assistant, Pitching
-> one of the most vibrant communities of Berlin

Follow us on Twitter, Facebook and Slack:
https://twitter.com/wtm_berlin
https://www.facebook.com/groups/1106085959408694
http://slack.wtmberlin.com

events.name: WTMB: JavaScript Crash Course Vol.2 Lecture 7: The Frontend
events.description:
Welcome to Women Techmakers Berlin's JavaScript autumn course! For this meetup, we teamed up with Codemotion. Use the following code, to get a 20% discount on conference tickets:
COMMUNITY_WOMENTECHMAKERSBERLIN

The course will be spread over 8 weekly meetings, we will go from learning the fundamentals to having your very own backend application deployed with Docker.

Maria Ovsyannikova, co-organizer: I am one of the graduates from the first edition. After finishing the course I got a 6-month internship position. I currently work as a full-time Junior Full-stack Software Engineer.

Lecture 1: JavaScript & ES6 Fundamentals
An introduction on how JavaScript works and how to take advantage of the new ES6 syntax and features. In this session, we cover the basic programming paradigms in JavaScript, as well as topics like OOP and functional programming. We use the Chrome browser as a playground for an interactive session.

Here is our Syllabus (http://wtmberlin.com/javascript-crash-course/).

The course will be instructed by a team of developers, headed by Armağan Amcalar, Head of Software Engineering at unu GmbH (https://unumotors.com), and will be hosted at Eurostaff, in Mitte on Wednesdays.

Course description:
This is a course designed for introducing JavaScript and Node.js as a platform for backend applications. It assumes that you know basic concepts of (object oriented) programming but we will start from the beginner level and build up. So, the more programming experience, the better — but total newbies are also welcome, provided that they invest the required amount of time for self-learning.

The course is designed around open-source technologies, so a Unix-like system, Linux or MacOS is preferred. Git and Visual Studio Code will be our main tools, along with Node.js. Windows is not preferred, but if you absolutely have to live on Windows, you should have a working git and Node.js installation, and the rest will work.

FAQ
- #js-crash-course on our slack
- Some previous programming knowledge would be really useful
- It's completely free
- It's both for beginners and not-so beginners
- Ideally you'll keep working on your project at home
- We are meeting every WEDNESDAY until 5th of December
- The meetups at the Eurostaff office
- There will be drinks and snacks
- All genders are welcome
- RSVP opens one week in advance

About our Head of Instructors
Armagan is a software architect from Berlin and currently works as the Head of Software Engineering at unu GmbH.

Following the software craftsmanship philosophy, he has taught over 40 young engineering graduates on software and helped them enter the software industry.

For the last five years, he has been focusing on distributed cloud architectures and developed among many others an open-source framework, cote.js, for building microservices with Node.js.

Follow Armagan on twitter.com/dashersw, https://github.com/dashersw or on his own blog https://arm.ag.

About Women Techmakers


Apart from programming courses, we organize workshops on topics like Public Speaking, React, Angular, Google Assistant and Fireside Chats with companies supporting diversity in Berlin’s tech ecosystem.

Slack http://slack.wtmberlin.com #js-crash-course
Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/WomenTechmakersBerlinPage/
Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1106085959408694/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/WTM_berlin
Meetup: www.meetup.com/women-Techmakers-Berlin/

events.name: Parents & Tech Brunch
events.description:
Technology is surrounding us. Everywhere, all the time. It’s in the hands of our children and shaping the worlds of their parents. We understand that being a parent with and in tech is not easy, but we want to make this statement not relevant, showing that it is doable and rewarding!

In the end, almost every parent is one in tech these days and children are the future savers of the Internet. Mozilla and Women Techmakers Berlin want to help parents and children navigate through this diverse, colorful, wonderful and sometimes opaque or even dangerous technical world: How can children be protected online? What possibilities and dangers are there? It will be topics like these that occupy us here.

We will come together with parents and supportive organizations to discuss the subject of keeping children safe online. Children (age 13 and under) will have the opportunity to take part in digital workshops and childcare will also be provided.

AGENDA
• 10:00 – Arrival
• 10:45 – Welcome & Introduction
• 11:00 – 11:15 – A talk for parents and experts about digital safety for children, by Lisa Trujillo, Technologist and Privacy Researcher, and Florian Frank, a Cyber Security and Business Expert
• 11:00 – 12:30 – 2 Children's Workshops: 1) Saving the World with Robots - Basics of Coding for Children by EduHeros Club, and 2) Coding Your Ways Through Virtual Reality by bit&Byte
• 11:15 – 13:00 – Open discussion for parents and experts, plus brunch
• 13:00 – Closing

👧 👦 CHILDREN'S WORKSHOP REGISTRATION 👧 👦
1) Saving the World with Robots - Basics of Coding for Children (ages 6-10): https://goo.gl/forms/zfpGURJirklZojnr2
2) Coding Your Ways Through Virtual Reality (ages 6-13): https://goo.gl/forms/sczo7xF4DT5ijP762

👧 👦 CHILDCARE? REGISTER HERE 👧 👦
Free child care (ages 3+) will be provided with registration here: https://goo.gl/forms/p4Vrhny2bEdA5Gjy1

👧 👦 NEED HELP? MESSAGE US! 👧 👦
We understand that it may be hard to attend the whole event, especially with younger kids. Please feel free to RSVP and attend even if it's just for a few hours. If you will need additional help - please reach out! It's important for us to make our events as accessible as possible.

❤ ABOUT THE CHILDREN'S WORKSHOP PROVIDERS ❤
bit&Byte Creative Technology Academy is based in Lithuania and Germany. They gather technology enthusiasts and educators to teach curious 7 - 12 year olds essential programming concepts. Their aim is to combine learning and experimenting with the never-ending challenges of creativity, and to raise courageous, self-confident creators of tomorrow!
For more info visit: https://bitbyte.lt/en/

EduHeros Club helps young learners discover their super powers by promoting 21st century skills through code. For more info visit: https://www.eduheroes.club

❤ ABOUT MOZILLA ❤
The direct work of the Mozilla Foundation focuses on fueling the movement for an open Internet. They do this by connecting open Internet leaders with each other and by mobilizing grassroots activists around the world. The Foundation is also the sole shareholder in the Mozilla Corporation, the maker of Firefox and other open source tools. Mozilla Corporation functions as a self-sustaining social enterprise – money earned through its products is reinvested into the organization.
Mozilla Berlin Blog: https://blog.mozilla.org/berlin
Mozilla Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mozilla_de
Mozilla Twitter: https://twitter.com/Mozilla_DE
Download Firefox: https://mozilla.org/de

❤ ABOUT WTM BERLIN ❤
At Women Techmakers Berlin (WTMB) we have been encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. Gain visibility, networking and resources to make Berlin's tech community more inclusive! Our Meetup group is always open and inclusive to people of all backgrounds, regardless of gender, age, race, expertise, etc - everyone is welcome!

http://twitter.com/wtm_berlin

Join us on FACEBOOK:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/1106085959408694

And join us on SLACK:

events.name: iOS Study Jam #9 Session
events.description:
Are you interested in learning Swift/iOS? Then this is the right study jam for you.
We are excited to invite you to our iOS Study Jam 2018. There will be 10 sessions between Oct 2nd - December 4th, one every week, each lasting for approximately 3h.

★ #9 Study Jam ★: App. Your own idea. Part 3

This session will be dedicated completely to all of you. Do you have ideas of your own app? Do you want to solve an everyday annoying issue with the help of the app? Here is the chance for you.
The format will change this time - we will work in small groups with dedicated mentors, and everyone will have the possibility to ask questions and work on their own app. Remember labs in school? Here it is!

★Presenter★:

Chris Eidhof
Chris is one of the founders of objc.io and co-author of the books Functional Swift, Advanced Swift, and most recently App Architecture. Before that, he started UIKonf and Deckset.
Twitter: https://twitter.com/chriseidhof

Jan Gorman
Engineering Lead at Zalando Lounge. Formerly at Dailymotion, the other Zalando and countless others.
Twitter: https://twitter.com/JanGorman

★ Who is this for? ★

You are new to Swift/iOS: This is your first experience with it!

You have some previous programming experience: This Study Jam does not cover the basics of programming!

You are willing to learn in an inclusive, safe space and willing to follow our code of conduct: http://berlincodeofconduct.org/

★ What will you need? ★
-> Mac and charger
-> Create a free account at https://developer.apple.com/
-> Install Xcode 10.0 > from the https://developer.apple.com/download/
-> Curiosity and your desire to learn

At Women Techmakers Berlin we have been encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. We strive for visibility, networking and resources to make the tech community of Berlin inclusive. We are one of the most active chapters of the global Women Techmakers program run by Google.

Our meetup groups are always open to people of all backgrounds, regardless of gender, age, race, expertise, etc. - everyone is welcome!

-> Programming courses: Javascript Study Jam, Kotlin Study Jam, Flutter Study jam

events.name: Involving engineers in the UX process
events.description:
Women Techmakers Berlin is one of the most active chapters of the global WTM program run by Google. We are a very inclusive community supporting the diversity in the tech industry in many ways, for example through organizing free events with tech in focus. Our events range from coding courses, Fireside Chats to one time workshops on soft skills or technical topics like Angular, React or Google Assistant.
We are open not only to women but to everyone who respects the Berlin's Code of Conduct - be nice, respectful and excellent to each other!
More info at the bottom of the page

★ ABOUT THE EVENT ★
Starting to build a (software) product has become easier and more accessible than ever before. You take your laptop and get started on your brilliant idea. But sooner or later you’ll need more advanced skills in certain areas. You hire a designer and a developer. But the product development does not take off as expected, because the collaboration between the two is rocky.
So, why can’t we all just get along to create awesome products?

7:10PM - 7:30PM
#Getting it Wrong: Lessons in Empathy, Failure & Stealing Agendas
by Hailey Griffiths.
Being the only UX person in an engineering team can be tough. Hailey's here to talk about making research collaborative, outsourcing UX tasks, and how building empathy can change a team.

7:40 PM - 8:00PM
#A designer, a developer and a half-baked product walk into a bar…
by Kristin Baumann @kristin_baumann
… trying to improve their collaboration issues & deliver a product with joy.
Kristin worked as a developer in a design team and will share her insights on the different perspectives and how the relationship between designers and developers can be improved step-by-step in your everyday work life.

★ ABOUT THE SPEAKER ★
Hailey fell into UX before she knew what it was, and was delighted to find that her inborn desire of “not wanting to annoy people” was a marketable skill. She believes deeply in the power of vulnerability and honesty.
She strives to grow them in any team she joins.

Kristin is a Senior Frontend Developer and has built tech products for the past couple of years. Her previous work as a developer in a design team has given her the opportunity to experience both sides of the designer-developer spectrum. As a result, she understands the true value and impact of a strong interdisciplinary collaboration. She currently works at the intersection of development, design and product management at Mein Grundeinkommen in Berlin.

★ ABOUT THE HOSTING COMPANY ★
OLX has been a host of one of our Fireside Chats - we are happy to collaborate again on this exciting event!

We’re a global product and tech group.
17 brands. 40 countries. 4000 people. One mindset.
Our mission is to make it easier for people to buy and sell almost anything, promoting prosperity in local communities.

We are proud to be different, and we work differently too. We combine the spirit and agility of a start-up with the maturity that comes from being part of a 100 year-old company.
We are curious, ambitious and allergic to corporate interference. We improvise, experiment and push each other further, embracing uncertainty and driving change.
https://www.olxgroup.com/

★ ABOUT WTM BERLIN ★
At Women Techmakers Berlin we have been encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015.
Our meetup groups are always open to people of all backgrounds, regardless of gender, age, race, expertise, etc. - everyone is welcome!

Follow us on TWITTER:
https://twitter.com/wtm_berlin

Join us on FACEBOOK:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/1106085959408694

And join the community on SLACK for info about upcoming events, job offers and other collaboration possibilities:
http://slack.wtmberlin.com

events.name: CryptoParty: Privacy for Beginners
events.description:
Do you want to learn how to protect yourself from being harrassed, hacked, or tracked in the digital space? Come to our first CryptoParty: an open workshop for introducing basic tools for protecting privacy, anonymity, and security on the Internet. There is absolutely no prior knowledge required: just bring your phone or laptop.

We will bring instructors from Private Matter—a project focused on building better, more secure internet—and have partnered with WeWork, who are hosting us in their wonderful Ku`Damm space.

★ What is a CryptoParty? ★

CryptoParty is a decentralized movement with events happening all over the world. The goal is to pass on knowledge about protecting yourself in the digital space. This can include encrypted communication, preventing being tracked while browsing the web, and general security advice regarding computers and smartphones.

CryptoParties are free and open for everyone, but especially ​those without prior knowledge, who haven't yet attended one.

Wiki: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CryptoParty
Website: https://www.cryptoparty.in/

★ Who is this for? ★

This is for everyone! You will get advice and some practical tips on online security and learn how to use tools for protecting your privacy on the Internet, which is what all of us need. No matter your level of knowledge, our event is an open environment to teach and learn from our instructors as well as each other.

★ Private Matter and our instructors ★

Karen Reilly is the Managing Director of Private Matter, a decentralized network project creating incentives and building blocks for developers to create apps that have privacy by design at their core. Previously, she worked on information security and censorship circumvention for NGOs, including The Tor Project.

Ed Medvedev is the Chief Technical Officer of Private Matter and one of the Women Techmakers Berlin organizers. He frequently takes part in information security competitions and likes to play around on the DEF CON network, often called the most dangerous network in the world.

★ WeWork ★

WeWork is a global network of workspaces where companies and people grow together. We transform buildings into dynamic environments for creativity, focus, and connection.

★ Women Techmakers Berlin ★

At Women Techmakers Berlin we have been encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. We strive for visibility, networking and resources to make the tech community of Berlin inclusive. We are one of the most active chapters of the global Women Techmakers program.

Our meetup groups are always open to people of all backgrounds, regardless of gender, age, race, expertise, etc. — everyone is welcome!

All our events are free of charge. We offer:
-> Fireside chats with experts from interesting companies and Q&A sessions
-> Programming courses: Javascript Study Jam, Kotlin Study Jam, Flutter Study Jam
-> Workshops on topics varying from Google Assistant to public speaking
-> Events with inspiring speakers and great presentations
-> One of the most vibrant tech communities in Berlin

Twitter: https://twitter.com/wtm_berlin
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1106085959408694
Slack: http://slack.wtmberlin.com

For the last five years, he has been focusing on distributed cloud architectures and developed among many others an open-source framework, cote.js, for building microservices with Node.js.

events.name: Build Your Tech CV
events.description:
You asked and we listened!

Interviewing can definitely be a difficult time and things get even harder when you are not sure how to best build your CV so that you receive those interview invitations. From cultural differences, to impostor syndrome, and many more factors , it can be really daunting.

We have been putting together a very hands on experience together with a wonderful team of volunteer coaches ( Recruiters and Professionals alike).

Bring your CV or ideas with what you would like to put in it and come join us in one of the 8 tracks below. This event is meant for graduates, interns, juniors and mid level professionals.
We kindly ask you to answer the question when RSVPing, as we have limited capacity and want to make sure you get the best possible experience during the event. We divided into:
- Frontend
- Backend
- Fullstack
- Data
- Mobile
- UX Design
- Product
- QA

events.name: DevOps Theory vs. Practice: A Song of Ice and TireFire
events.description:
Hi everyone,
we missed you dearly over the Winter break, and we are very excited to start 2019 together with you ♥

To kick off our 5th year of activity, we picked a whole new focus: DevOps!
And we got the best way to glimpse into it with a great speaker who will shed some light on what really goes behind the scenes.

Come with questions, business cards and an open mind, make friends and take the first steps in making 2019 an awesome year for you!
There will be swag.

★ THE TALK ★

In many DevOps talks, you see a speaker from a renowned tech company stand up and describe a perfect utopia of an environment. You look at the perfect environment and dedicated hordes of senior engineers they describe, and you despair of ever getting to that point. Your environment looks nothing like that.

Surprise! Their environment doesn't really look like that either! In this talk, a speaker from an unnamed tech unicorn describes their amazing environment-- and then what they just said gets translated from "thought leader" into plain English for you by an official DevOps translator. Stop feeling sad, everything is secretly terrible!

★ THE SPEAKER ★

Baruch Sadogursky (a.k.a JBaruch, also @JBaruch on Twitter) is the Head of Developer Relations and a Developer Advocate at JFrog. His passion is speaking about technology. Well, speaking in general, but doing it about technology makes him look smart, and 17 years of hi-tech experience sure helps. When he’s not on stage (or on a plane to get there), he learns about technology, people and how they work, or more precisely, don’t work together.

He is a CNCF ambassador, Groundbreakers Ambassador, and a professional conference speaker on DevOps, Java and Groovy topics, and is a regular at the industry’s most prestigious events including various JAX events, DockerCon, Devoxx, DevOps Days, Velocity, OSCON, JavaOne Qcon, and many others.

★ THE AGENDA ★

19:00 – 19:30 – Networking over Drinks and Snacks
19:30 – 19:45 – WTM Kicking off 2019
19:45 – 20:45 – DevOps Theory vs. Practice: A Song of Ice and TireFire / Baruch Sadogursky

- Strategy and Technology Consulting
- Development of Digital Products and Services
- Software Architecture and Development
- Digital Platforms and Infrastructures

events.name: How to Negotiate Your Salary
events.description:
When preparing for an interview you are going over your CV, listing your achievements, thinking of your strong and weak points, and going over some technical questions. And then comes the question - what is your salary expectations?

Let's focus on that one question: how to know how much you want? how to negotiate it? should you ask for 20% more because it will be negotiated? maybe 40% more? should you compromise for 30% less because you really want that job? how to convince the other person you deserve more?

For all this and more, join our panel! We have some amazing ladies who will discuss these questions, share their experience and give valuable tips.

★ THE SCHEDULE ★

18:30 - 19:00 Networking over drinks

19:00 - 19:15 Welcome words

19:15 - 20:00 Panel

20:00 - 20:45 Q&A from the crowd

20:45 - 21:30 Networking over drinks

★ THE SPEAKERS ★

★ Ela Krief, VP of Partnerships and Coaching Lead @Adikteev
Ela has more than ten years experience working in startups as a business operations and sales professional. She has been working in the AdTech industry for the past eight years, catering for clients globally.
Throughout her career, she facilitated the rapid growth of teams, hiring dozens of people and interviewing hundreds.

Today, she's the VP of partnerships and coaching lead at Adikteev, an AdTech company, where she trains sales and client facing teams on how to manage relationships and growth, effectively. She focuses on operational excellence, internal processes, sales and growth through a transversal approach, as well as creating and maintaining partnerships with different players in the mobile space.

In her free time, Ela is supporting managers, mainly women, in their career search, career growth, salary negotiations and dealing with day-to-day managerial challenges in the workplace.

★ Lucia Hegenbartova, COO and Managind Director @Contiamo
Lucia is the COO of one of the currently fastest growing German tech companies. She loves building things on a green field and the creative chaos of the early startup days. In the last 10 years, she built Sales, Marketing and PeopleOps teams in three tech startups.

★ Ronna Steinberg, Senior Software Engineer @OptioPay
Ronna is a senior engineer with 15 years of experience. She leads Women Who Go Berlin and offers free mentorships to women and gender minorities who wish to progress in software. She describes herself as a happy feminist, advocates that coding is for everyone, absolutely loves architecture and solving problems and will be happy to share that passion with you.

★ THE VENUE ★

Volkswagen Digital:Lab is Part of Group IT. Software is our business, Platform our Passion. Our day is based on empathy, transparency and short feedback loops for both our end-users and teammates. We build software using Lean UX and extreme programming methodologies but most important through small and balanced teams which are enabled to take decisions based on the users’ needs and our company’s goals.

events.name: Mindfulness from an Engineering Perspective
events.description:
Let's give some focus to Mindfulness, but from the engineering perspective, as brought to us by the technical cofounder of one of Berlin's successful data science startups.

Talk Description:

From incense and crystals to mindfulness based stress reduction therapy - meditation can mean almost anything. Let's strip away the more esoteric parts and identify concepts and techniques that are usful in understanding the complex machinery of our mind.

We will look at meditation through the lens of neuroscience, behavioural science and evolutionary biology and will take an analytical look into how our brain creates our conscious experience and how observing and modifying these processes within the context of mindfulness can help us become better engineers.

AGENDA:

Avid runner and VR/AR enthusiast.

events.description:
We all know that 2018 was heavily focused on GDPR, data protection, privacy by design, and now we want to discuss what to look for in product development in tech for the upcoming months or even year.
We rounded 3 great speakers for you, each one of them with a unique approach and focus.

Marta is a Product Manager passionate about product discovery and solving real customer problems through machine learning. At Zalando, she's building a completely new product called Algorithmic Fashion Companion, which helps customers to explore algorithmically created outfits. Before joining Zalando, she worked in various tech startups and at Microsoft.

★ Domile Janenaite - Product Manager @ Humanitec ★
Domile started her career in Lithuania and "landed" in Berlin's tech scene through working for Tech Open Air. She then joined Digital Knights - a startup that performs technical due diligence on 200+ dev teams in Europe, where she travelled to the top digital hubs, observed local development communities and created an invite-only network of high performing dev teams. During this time she found her passion for product development and building collaborative dev teams. She recently went through a product development bootcamp at Humanitec and became a PM. She has been focusing on creating a service-oriented team approach.

events.name: International Women's Day - the main event!
events.description:
Join us for the 5th International Women's Day by Women Techmakers Berlin, part of the global series of the Women Techmakers chapters, which is also our birthday! All genders are welcome!

★ THE PLAN ★
- Great talks by great speakers
- Healthy food
- Networking
- Awesome swag

★ THE SCHEDULE ★

12:30 - 13:00 - Jana Sloan van Geest - "Sisterhood: The Importance of Women's Networks"
13:00 - 14:00 - Lunch

★ THE SPEAKERS ★
★ Alina Cucu - Software Engineer @ Yilu ★
Alina is a (mainly) self-taught software & data engineer. She transitioned into tech after completing the FrauenLoop program and following a stubborn learning routine during her maternity leave.

★ Jana Sloan van Geest - Game Writer @ Wooga ★
Jana is a writer at Wooga in Berlin. Her shipped titles include Assassin's Creed: Origins (Ubisoft Montreal), Battlestar Galactica: Squadrons (Ludia), and Horizon Zero Dawn: The Frozen Wilds (Guerrilla Games). She also founded the Pixelles Game Writing Incubator, a specialized training program for women who aspire to careers in game writing.

★ Diana Rees - Founder @ zkSystems.io ★
Diana Rees is CEO and Founder of zkSystems, a blockchain infrastructure layer which enables full autonomy of complex IoT ecosystems such as smart factories or smart cities. She is a serial entrepreneur, who has founded 2 startups previously, and made an exit with her last startup 3 years ago.

★ Mayya Vu - Project Manager @ Qubstudio (Twitter: @vu_mayya) ★
Mayya is a Women Techmakers Lviv lead, CocoaHeads Lviv co-organizer, operations manager at iLike dance complex (local dance studio), and 3rd-year student of Software engineering course Lviv Polytechnic National University. Other than tech, she likes choreography, skiing, and traveling.

The Career Corner is a welcoming spot to get all your career questions answered and hear insights from industry professionals. Throughout the day, you'll be able to get feedback on your CV, try a dry-run job interview in a friendly environment, discuss diversity & inclusion at the workplace, and ask mentors anything about advancing in engineering, management, and other career tracks in Berlin's startup scene.

Ed Medvedev, a Google Developer Expert and CTO at Tungsten Labs, is joining us as a lead mentor for the Career Corner!

Wooga’s aim is to play a memorable and positive part in people’s lives and create joyful moments they look forward to playing everyday. Find out more at wooga.com.

venue.name: Hochschule für Technik und Wirtschaft Berlin (HTW Berlin) - Campus Wilhelminenhof

events.description:
The HTW and WTM Berlin are joining forces to bring you the very first Women Tech Stage conference: http://womentechstage.f4.htw-berlin.de

★ THE PLAN ★

- great talks by great speakers
- healthy food
- networking
- awesome swag
- child friendly!

The bachelor degree program Computer Science and Business Administration is one out of a wide range of programs with an ICT specialization. It is a women only program which was established in 2009 in order to gain more women for the field. It is a success story as many of our students and alumnae would not have entered the IT community otherwise.

With the WomenTechStage event, the HTW is celebrating the 10th Birthday of the program in collaboration with WTM!

WomenTechStage is an open conference and networking format which provides women from the field visibility to address a topic of their choice. This year the various talks have been aligned under the heading: How to deal with master challenges.

The talks have a length of 10 to 15 Minutes. All the speakers are going through training to improve speaking techniques beforehand! During the event the speakers will be recorded and the talks will be uploaded afterwords.

The goal is to showcase the work and passions of women by providing an online and offline platform to celebrate their talents and empower them and others on their way into the tech community.

http://womentechstage.f4.htw-berlin.de/

★ THE VENUE ★

plista is a global platform for data-driven native advertising in premium editorial environments and offers advertisers and publishers direct, single-source access to a broad portfolio of native solutions. The Headquarters are in Mitte, Berlin and it boasts 25+ offices worldwide.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
★ SPEAKERS: ★
Anne Schumann: Junior Software Developer
A year ago, Anne was an unemployed mother with limited perspective in her professional life. She overcame this situation by learning how to code. As a self-taught developer she started her first job in the tech industry in January 2019. Starting with a masters degree in philosophy and sociology, Anne is now responsible for the mobile app of a software company that is building facility management products and has found her passion.

Ricky McMaster: Teamlead Data Analytics
Ricky originally studied English Literature at the University of Glasgow. After several years in university administration, he began working as an HR Information Officer, which was his first introduction to SQL and BI. He has since then had professional experience at several start-ups, e-commence firms and larger, more established companies, in a variety of areas such as ETL, data management, reporting and analysis.

Karla Schoenicke: Product Owner
Karla currently works as a Product Owner at RatePAY, where she is responsible for all customer-facing platforms. With a background in International Business Administration and her self-taught tech skills she steadily moved into digital product management to build innovative and useful software. Karla is a firm believer in agile methods, user centric design and diverse teams. She was amongst the TOP10 finalists of RAHM 2018, the LGBT leadership contest, and named as one of the 50 Women in Product in Europe List 2018.

Eva Larumbe: Web Developer
Eva is currently a Web Developer, Designer and Mentor at the Frauenloop organisation in Berlin. Eva studied Psychology, and moved torwards freelance web development soon after graduation. Having previously worked at Soundcloud, she loves working with artists, community groups and warm-hearted businesses to amplify their unique voice in the digital world. Her journey has been more about collecting life experiences than climbing a career ladder.

• 19:15 – 19:30 – Welcome Words by the WTM Team and Fraugster

• 21:00 – 21:30 – Networking

⭐ THE PANELISTS ⭐

⭐ Edie Ismene Nicolaou, Fraud Analyst at Fraugster

With a background in psychology and neuroscience, Edie’s work as an analyst is driven by her interest in modeling human thought processes. During her master’s studies she completed research using big data to study the cognitive process of learning. At Fraugster, she has enjoyed working on projects that combine both traditional analytics and data science methods for understanding the stories behind online fraud.
She considers herself a multidisciplinary thinker and deeply cares about using technology for a good purpose.

⭐ Janine Gleichmann, Head of Consumer Risk at RatePAY

Janine is Head of Consumer Risk at RatePAY and has worked in Risk Management in the company since 2016. She is responsible for customer risk assessment and fraud prevention. She is a qualified bank clerk and has a bachelor’s degree in Business
Administration and Business Psychology. Having previously worked at Zalando Payments GmbH, she has more than eight years’ experience in fraud prevention.

⭐ Michal Maman, Senior Team Leader Risk Ops at PayPal

⭐ Sophia von Stockert, Fraud Analyst at Fraugster

Sophia studied Psychology and Neuroscience at Maastricht University and at the University of Amsterdam. During her first stats classes she became fascinated with data analysis and statistical methods which led her to pursue a research trajectory during her Master's. When Fraugster recruited for analysts who had a deep understanding of social science/psychology on the one hand and datascience/stats on the other, she joined their Risk Team. As an analyst, she deep dives into data structures to identify and understand fraudulent behavior and build tools to prevent fraud from happening. She's also worked as a tutor and mentor for many years.

Moderator: Natalie Pistunovich (@NataliePis)

💼 THE VENUE 💼

Fraugster is a payment security company that is eliminating fraud and increasing our customers’ profits. Over the last years we’ve invented an artificial intelligence technology that combines human-like accuracy with machine scalability. This ability lets us foresee fraudulent attacks before they actually happen and gives us a distinct competitive advantage over every other player in the payment security space.

events.name: The Delivery-Driven Workplace
events.description:
Working in a team can be confusing - we make our own assumptions about what’s required from us, and we cope with other team members’ sets of expectations. Let’s discuss some of the pitfalls of working in a team, review underlying assumptions, and see how we can combine effective individual contribution with positive team wide collaboration.

★ AGENDA ★

• 19:00 – 19:15 – Networking over Drinks and Snacks
• 19:15 – 19:30 - Welcome Words by the WTM Team and WATTx
• 19:30 – 20:45 – The Delivery-Driven Workplace / Ela Krief and Dan Elharrar
• 20:45 – 21:30 – Networking

★ THE SPEAKER ★

Dan Elharrar is the CTO of SeeTrue, leveraging Artificial Intelligence for airport optimization. Formerly the CTO of Cortica, Israeli AI powerhouse. Dan has been leading algorithmic teams in startups, with his delivery-oriented style, focusing on individual contribution, positive team dynamics and on growing tech leaders.

Ela Krief is an independent Business advisor for startups. She facilitated the rapid growth of teams, interviewed hundreds and hired dozens. She led client facing teams in several tech companies. Her focus is on promoting operational excellence, change management and implementing an unbiased hiring system. One of her passions is to support women in their career path as a consultant and mentor.

★ THE VENUE ★

WATTx is a venture builder focused on shaping new and rapidly evolving industries. We create deep tech products and companies that solve industrial problems, with a user-centric approach. Our team conducts focused research, triggering informed solutions that we take from concept to prototype to launch. https://twitter.com/WATTxBerlin

events.name: How to Build Your Network by Creating Value for Others
events.description:
Most of us know that networking is essential, for both getting things done in our day-to-day jobs and for our longer-term career progression. But networking can be also intimidating, stressful and feel transactional. In this talk Rotem will introduce a new way to network -instead of using people to get what you want, you can develop long-term, trusting relationships with essential connections – in which you give as much (or more) than you take.

★ AGENDA ★

• 18:30 – 19:15 – Networking over Drinks and Snacks
• 19:15 – 19:30 - Welcome Words by the WTM Team and VW Dig:Lab
• 19:30 – 20:30 – How to Build Your Network by Creating Value for Others / Rotem Carmely
• 20:30 – 21:00 – Networking

★ THE SPEAKER ★

Rotem Carmely is the co-founder and CEO of Clustered. Clustered is a data-driven matchmaking solution, built to cut the noise out the networking equation. Clustered is using data to increase the chances of connecting people to the right individuals and increasing the quality and value of their networks.

★ THE VENUE ★

Volkswagen Digital:Lab is Part of Group IT. Software is our business, Platform our Passion. Our day is based on empathy, transparency and short feedback loops for both our end-users and teammates. We build software using Lean UX and extreme programming methodologies but most important through small and balanced teams which are enabled to take decisions based on the users’ needs and our company’s goals.

events.name: Introduction to Sketchnoting
events.description:
Sketchnoting, a form of visual note taking, has been growing and growing in popularity. We see beautiful sketchnotes from conferences and meetups and we think "They are great, however I am not a creative person" - let's stop, press pause and give them a try.
Let's take our curiosity, willingness to try something new, a pen/pencil and a notepad, and meet at Le Wagon where the wonderful Anja Riese will give a talk followed by a short practical session.

Curious to learn more about sketchnotes in general? Check out Anja's website: https://www.anjariese.com/Sketchnote-Workshops

★ AGENDA ★

• 18:30 – 19:00 – Arrival Time
• 19:00 – 19:10 – Welcome Words by the WTM Team and Le Wagon
• 19:15 – 20:00 – Anja Riese: Introduction to Sketchnoting + Practice Time
• 20:00 – 21:00 – Networking

★ THE SPEAKER ★
Anja is an illustrator, ui designer & visual designer, sketchnoter & graphic recorder based in Berlin. You can find more about her work here: https://www.anjariese.com/

★ THE VENUE ★

Le Wagon is Europe's leading coding school for entrepreneurs and creative people. We are now present in 40 cities worldwide, with over 120 startups in operation, and have been rated the no#1 coding bootcamp worldwide on Course Report & Switchup! Our 9-week, full-stack web development course equips aspiring entrepreneurs, product managers, designers, and junior developers with the technical skills they need to build great products and startups.

events.name: Product Series #4
events.description:
We're continuing our product event series with another evening full of inspiring talks. We will be learning more about product development in different domains and countries.
More details will follow soon.

★ AGENDA ★

• 18:30 – 19:00 Arrival Time
• 19:00 – 19:10 Welcome Words by the WTM Team and Delivery Hero
• 19:15 Understand the super mobile apps in China by Min Wang
• 19:45 "Product Management" is Radical Candor by Megan Wade
• 20:30 – 21:30 – Networking

★ THE SPEAKERS ★
★ Min Wang ★ - "Understand the super mobile apps in China"
Born, raised and worked in Shanghai, China, Min witnesses the rise of China’s tech unicorns. Now after two and half years in Europe, Min would like to share her observations.
Min’s life in Europe started from the MBA program at INSEAD in France. She has been in Berlin and working at BuildingMinds, a B2B startup, as product manager for the past a year and a half. Before that, Min was a marketer working for Honeywell in the smart building industry.
Min is an F1 fanatic and tennis fan. She is also passionate about musicals and spoken word poetry.

★ Megan Wade ★
Megan Allison Wade is a Senior Director of Product Management at Delivery Hero SE, a Berlin-based holding company of 20+ food delivery applications in 30+ countries around the world. She moved to Berlin six months ago from San Francisco, where she spent 10 years delivering digital experiences to production at tiny startups and large corporations. She's into Lean UX, experimentation, cleaning up technical debt, and third wave coffee.

★ THE VENUE ★

Delivery Hero is the largest global online food ordering and delivery marketplace company, and Germany's largest tech IPO of the last decade. Delivery Hero is not one app: we operate over 15 restaurant food and last-mile delivery brands in more than 30 countries around the world. Customers experience us through Talabat and Carriage in the Middle East, Foodora in Europe and Foodpanda in Southeast Asia, PedidosYa in South America, and many more. Our strength is in our diversity and global reach: in our Berlin HQ employees from over 75 countries work together to deliver the best global solutions in app development, B2B ordering and logistics software. (PS. We're hiring!) https://www.deliveryhero.com/about/

events.name: Public speaking workshop: You should give a talk this year!
events.description:
! IMPORTANT UPDATE - LOCATION CHANGED!

★ ABOUT THE EVENT★
Our public speaking series is a very hands-on and collaborative workshop, focused on people getting actual help with composing their talk proposals (so bring drafts and we will work on them!) and improving in public speaking.

join #public-speaking-event channel on our slack http://slack.wtmberlin.com/ for questions, discussions and other cooperations.

[Motivation & best practices[masked]]
1st event: we will cover topics like most common problems and challenges, best practices for approaching public speaking, selection of the topic and building outlines.

[Write a great talk proposal[masked]]
2nd event: best practices od writing abstracts/proposals for submitting the talks. We want to encourage more people from our community to apply for conferences, especially if it's their first time

[Practical tips for composing the talks[masked]]
3rd event: create your talk and practise by presenting a short version, get direct feedback

★ ABOUT THE SPEAKER ★
Armagan is a Senior Engineering Manager at Wayfair. He has years of hands-on experience founding and leading multiple startups and innovative products.

A software architect well versed in both the backend and frontend systems, he focuses on building resilient clouds. He loves open source and is the author of cote, a library for building microservices with Node.js, among many others. In his free time, he loves to hack stuff with JavaScript, ranging from musical gadgets to brain signals processing.

Armagan is a public speaker, a mentor and a lecturer. He also leads Lonca, a software craftsmanship school for women engineers, and teaches JavaScript at Women Techmakers Berlin.

★ ABOUT HOSTING COMPANY ★
Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. https://www.wayfair.com/

★ ABOUT WTM BERLIN ★
At Women Techmakers Berlin we have been encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. We strive for visibility, networking and resources to make the tech community of Berlin inclusive. We are one of the most active chapters of the global Women Techmakers program run by Google.

Our meetup groups are always open to people of all backgrounds, regardless of gender, age, race, expertise, etc. - everyone is welcome!

All our events are free of charge. We offer:
-> FiresideChats with interesting companies with Q&A Sessions
-> Programming courses: Javascript Study Jam, Kotlin Study Jam, Flutter Study jam
-> Workshops on topics like Google Assistant, Pitching
-> one of the most vibrant communities of Berlin

Follow us on TWITTER:
https://twitter.com/wtm_berlin

Join us on FACEBOOK:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/1106085959408694

And join is on SLACK:
http://slack.wtmberlin.com

events.name: Machine Learning - Bias, data privacy, personalisation & digital airports
events.description:
Machine learning - everyone's talking about it. We hear and read about various use cases for it, about ethics, bias and discrimination challenges, as well as the data itself.
We have found a group of wonderful speakers who will be sharing some of their work addressing these topics.

There are a limited number of spots available so please use the RSVP button responsibly so that you and other community members can enjoy this event.
We kindly ask everyone to follow our code of conduct (http://berlincodeofconduct.org/), and to provide their name (first and last) in order to be able to receive the badge and enter the venue.

★ AGENDA ★

• 18:45 – 19:15 Arrival Time (Food & Drinks)
• 19:15 – 19:30 Welcome Words
• 19:30 – 20:10 "Bias in Machine Learning: causes, effects and solutions" by Agnes van Belle & Hagop Boghazdeklian
• 20:15 – 20:45 "Data Privacy meets personalisation: Running machine learning on smartphones" by Sophie Chauvin
• 21:00 – 21:30 "Building the digital airport: solving transportation problems using cloud ecosystems and APIs" by Tyler Ayers
• 21:30 – 22:00 Networking, Food & Drinks

★ THE SPEAKERS ★
★ Agnes van Belle ★
Agnes is a Data Scientist at OLX Group for both the Search and Experimentation teams, focusing on improving the experience and fairness of consumer product buying and selling, and A/B tests. Formerly, she worked as Search R&D team lead at Textkernel, an Amsterdam-based company that makes software for the HR industry to automatically match people with jobs by parsing and ranking CVs and vacancies. Agnes studied Artificial Intelligence at the University of Amsterdam, and has been a panel member at Berlin Buzzwords, ECIR, ECML-PKDD, and Haystack Europe. Her main interests are around information retrieval and NLP.

★ Hagop Boghazdeklian ★
Hagop Boghazdeklian is a Data Scientist at OLX Group, where he focuses on Trust and Safety related projects, such as ad and chat moderation. Hagop studied Data Science and Econometrics at the Aix-Marseille University in France. He's passionate about Deep Learning applied to image processing and NLP.

★ Sophie Chauvin ★
Sophie used to be a researcher in physics before joining the thrilling world of tech. She worked for 2 years in a cybersecurity start-up in Paris, where she launched the data-science team. She moved to Berlin in April, to join Mobimeo. She is now applying machine learning to the field of urban mobility. She is particularly excited about designing ML-based solutions for real-world problems, and thinking about data strategy, research risk mitigation, productionizing prototypes and, of course, about helping reduce the carbon footprint of urban travellers.

★ Tyler Ayers ★
Tyler Ayers is a software architect and developer at Google working with customers on their Goggle Cloud projects, specifically on their API programs using Apigee API Management, and on app modernization, ecosystem, and hybrid cloud projects. He enjoys building web and mobile apps that hep people gain access to more qualified and trustworthy information online.

events.name: Making a transition into Tech: mobile development for Android
events.description:
This event is for all those taking their first steps in learning programming for Android development.

Whether you’ve already started or have zero programming experience, have a side project or are searching for a job, come and join us at the Android Study Jam: a series of 3 workshops run by Women Techmakers in conjunction with the organisers of the Berlin Android community. This is the 5th edition of the Android Study Jam and with this event trio we are testing a new format, hope you will enjoy it!

During the course, you will get a general overview of mobile development for Android, learn basic programming concepts as well as core vocabulary and concepts in Android, get hands-on experience building a small app using the Kotlin language, and understand what opportunities exist for you in the vibrant Berlin tech scene as an Android programmer. https://github.com/WTMBerlin/AndroidStudyJam2019

Besides technical skills, we will also cover other important skills for being an effective programmer, such as communicating your progress, giving and receiving feedback, searching for learning resources. And much more! 🚀
More detailed information and materials are here: http://wtmberlin.com/android-study-jam/

👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻

16.09 - Discussion Panel: Switching Careers and Becoming an Android Developer 💾
- Everyday work of Android developers
- The technology used in most projects
- Preparing for the job search
- Support in the community
- A Q&A session

Note 📈: This session will be appropriate for anyone interested in learning more about the field and prior programming knowledge will not be necessary. Laptops are optional here.

23.09 - Technical workshop [BRING YOUR LAPTOP] 💾
- Install and configure Android Studio andSlack
- Open and run your first Android project
- Get a small intro to Github
- Learn how to make use of online resources to effectively problem solve if you get stuck.
- Homework assignments: Say Hi on Slack, examine the course code and Android Studio once per day.

30.09 - Technical workshop [BRING YOUR LAPTOP] 💾
- Create an Android app with XML and Kotlin
- Giving and receiving feedback
- Reading technical documentation and internet resources
- Intro to handling errors
- Stand-up meeting

👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻

We will meet on Mondays between 18:00- 21:30 for three weeks with experienced Android developers present to instruct and help you. Working at home is not required but is encouraged. We also recommend you attend all sessions if you have no to little programming experience.

This is just the start for you though. After the course ends, there will still be plenty of support and opportunities for you from within the Berlin Android community with free weekly co-learning meetups , monthly presentations and drinks, free/discounted conference tickets. The Android community is open to all people from all backgrounds.

We follow Berlin’s code of conduct https://berlincodeofconduct.org

👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻👩🏾‍💻

More detailed information and resources here: http://wtmberlin.com/android-study-jam/

events.name: Agile Teams in Automotive
events.description:
Collaboration, knowledge sharing and effective communication are key factors to building a great product and designing the user experience. How do cross-functional agile product teams work to create digital automotive products? Join us for a very special evening with Ruba Kharrubi, senior software engineer @ VW Digital Lab and Virginie Caplet, product designer @ VW Digital Lab who will share their insights about the day-to-day practices that empower their team members to be part of shaping the user experience.

★ THE SPEAKERS ★

Virginie Caplet
Profession: Product designer.
Current obsession: sharing her practices and knowledge with every members of a team through products made in a lean way and with a steady pace.
Motto: Pairing is caring

Ruba Kharrubi
A software engineer with over ten years of professional experience with a wide range of technologies and development methods. She believes That teamwork is the key factor to solve problems and increase productivity and quality.

★ ABOUT HOSTING COMPANY ★

Volkswagen Digital:Lab is Part of Group IT. Software is our business, Platform our Passion. Our day is based on empathy, transparency and short feedback loops for both our end-users and teammates. We build software using Lean UX and extreme programming methodologies but most important through small and balanced teams which are enabled to take decisions based on the users’ needs and our company’s goals.
